text: This hotel is truly amazing, from the building, to the location, the rooms, the ambiance, and the staff. I stayed at the Ace Brooklyn on a road trip from Detroit with my dog. The experience of the stay was great even from before booking when I called to make sure it was okay to bring my very large dog--they are super dog friendly and it showed as soon as we got there! The staff was incredible and made my dog and me feel like we were home. I especially loved the night front desk staff; they were so friendly and even gave me great parking advice (it was super easy to park for free on the street by the way)!  The vibe of the rooms and the common areas is so hip but also inviting. I loved the design of the rooms and how they were super thoughtfully planned, right down to the light switch controls (which allowed dimming on all light fixtures and also the ability to turn all lights off at once by the bed AND front door). The furnishings are gorgeous, the bed and pillows are remarkably comfortable, and the room even had a turntable to play music. As a sustainability professional, I really appreciated the local, vintage, and small business sourcing for furniture and other furnishings.  One of the best parts of the room is the shower as well! I wanted to take it home with me. It's gorgeously designed but also the quality and water pressure are great.  This is my go-to from now on when I come to NYC. I already have my next stay booked in February for my friends' wedding! My dog and I both were in love with this hotel and enjoyed our stay thoroughly.

The staff was terrific!. Geneva and Sergio were very accommodating and super friendly. Lets not forget Mike who helped with our baggage and  getting a car after my Lyft cancelled. The Loft was amazing and with a great view and yummy treats. The decor was not the usual chain hotel variety. Modern and artistic. I loved it! I only wish I was staying more then 1 night  Thank you for helping to make my stay a memorable one.

Amazing stay for our first evening in Brooklyn. Very genuine, nice staff who were very accommodating with our extra needs this trip (tons of luggage with moving, etc). Beautiful, simple elegance to the room design that is actually functional (bathroom towel hangers, and coat luggage entry) and to finish off beautiful local artist works in each room and lobby area that is super inspiring. Love the robes, and the products in the room. Overall great experience!

What an amazing place! Clean, quiet rooms and funky decor! We had a vinyl player I could control inside my room and it was beautiful. The hotel bar and restaurant areas are elegant. The employees however, were the winners! They were cheerful, happy to help and exceeded my expectations.

Huge thank you to Darren at the front desk who helped find my expensive item I had left behind. He was so sweet and helpful and made me feel so well taken care of - even going to search my room himself while I waited on the phone!! Also huge thanks to their honest and hardworking housekeeping staff who turned in my item. Every staff member we interacted with over the weekend was extremely friendly and helpful.  The hotel lobby/bar is gorgeous and stylish. The rooms are clean, retro and fun. They make good use of their space and the king bed was super comfy.  I am a crazy light sleeper and the helpful front desk attendant (didn’t catch her name), put us in a room on the 8th floor. I slept great all weekend. No street noise and very minimal hallway noise.  My only tip to the hotel would be to add some type of coffee maker to the room. I wanted a coffee while getting ready late afternoon and there was literally no coffee to be had in the whole hotel (none in room and lobby cafe closed). This is an easy fix but would be much appreciated for guests!  Thanks for a great stay :)

As a newly former New Yorker, I am now always driving into the city for appointments and meetings and have been bouncing around trying out different hotels in Manhattan and Brooklyn. My room at the Ace BK was fine, nothing spectacular nor terrible, but the staff at this hotel is hands down the best I have encountered. I arrived at the Ace thinking I would move on to another hotel next trip but the experience I had there with the staff changed my mind completely. The bellman (Michael or was it Tony?, forgive me I'm blanking on the name) is just the best human. He so enthusiastically helped me so many times and went above and beyond for my partner and I throughout our entire trip. Additionally, every single person at the front desk was so accommodating and friendly at check in, with help printing, with deliveries, etc. I am really so pleasantly surprised that even with all of us being so incredibly spent mentally after these pandemic years, everyone at the Ace Hotel Brooklyn was just so lovely and I sincerely hope they are being compensated fairly for their excellent work. I will be back!

Lovely hotel in great location. I was here for three nights for work and the space, and room were perfect. Nice quiet rooms, good food options (though for us jetlagged travellers wouldn't mind if the restaurant opened a bit earlier), and really friendly staff. Only small niggle is there's no coffee in the rooms but wouldn't hesitate to come back here again.

Love the Ace Hotel Brooklyn, great spot for brunch and drinks. Design, furnishing and staff are great. Lots of room in the dining area and menu is full of fresh hits, the pastries are a gem. Even though its a hotel, it's become a local's spot, not a lot of place like that in the neighborhood.

The is another gimmicky NYC hotel with undersized rooms and high prices. My room had an acoustic guitar hanging on a wall and another guest room had a turntable. So what?  I had to climb over my wife to get out of bed due to the room size. First time in my life that I was in a hotel room with no coffee. The nice staff kept this from being a two star review

Couldn’t stop singing the praises for my experience here.  The hospitality showed reflected a warmth and kindness not always associated with big city living. The staff was knowledgeable patient and helpful to myself and all of my guests throughout our stay. The sound proof rooms allowed you to have peace in your own space or in our case not disturb others peace with our loud noise. The rooms came with guitars, record players and Bluetooth speakers helping you to make the space feel even more at home. This was made complete by the beautiful city views from the rooms massive windows.  The bathrooms while unique to each room were well thought out. From the large showers to the double vanity’s. The full length mirrors to the waterfall showers. The self care kits that come complimentary and their excellent choice of hypoallergenic soaps/hair care products.  The attached restaurant and bar were both just as warm and welcoming as the hotel staff itself. The bartenders were not only good at their job but knowledgeable about the surrounding areas drinking scene. The restaurant allowed me to have options despite my elaborate list of allergies. So wether your vegan, gluten free, keto, or hungover they will have something for you.  A big shout of praise to all of the staff that worked with me and my group specifically during the trip. Eager to come back and see you all again!

My stay at Ace brooklyn was excellent. By far, the best Ace location I've been to thus far. Location is great, I stayed here as a mini staycation for a BAM show, and had a wonderful time. Beautiful building, with As you Are, their little restaurant/diner, being a huge highlight. Loved working out in their retro gym during a snow day, looking out at the snow. The staff is delightful and really kind, which makes a huge difference. I paid for the Deluxe room, which I wished was just a little bit larger. Overall, I would definitely stay here again. The downstairs lounge/bar area was bustling, and its nice to see hospitality back again at full force.

Stayed at the ACE Brooklyn and had a fantastic stay. The service was super friendly and always ready to answer a question or help with whatever. The room was super cozy and felt like a styled apartment with tons of little details and even a guitar to play. We didn't have a chance to try the restaurant downstairs, but heard really great things from other guests that did, next time we will definitely check it out. All in all, it was a great visit and I'd definitely recommend it.

First the good, room is nice and spacious for a “small” and the bed is very comfortable. Lovely massive windows so it’s nice and bright in here.  The not so good, the windows are filthy, the HVAC unit is incredibly noisy but luckily isn’t on for long, the carpet has seen better days and there’s an attempted taping down of a rug with duct tape.  The worst, and possibly unforgivable thing, is the lack of coffee in rooms. Apparently it’s cause they want you to pay for the coffee from the coffee shop downstairs but that doesn’t open till 7:30. According to the front desk, they’ve had complaints since 5:30 this morning (and is a regular issue) from other guests and yet won’t provide coffee machines in the rooms. As someone who has several cups a day I would happily buy one or two from your cafe but I require one earlier than 7:30 am. Sort it out.

Showerhead nice and high. Quiet. Comfortable bed. Storage limited. Thermostat complicated. Water-pressure low. Pot to boil water but no tea or coffee to put in it. Bring your own instant coffee. Good food in restaurant.
Everything you could want in a hotel: gorgeous design; clean & comfortable rooms; attentive staff. Fantastic location made it easy to get anywhere in Brooklyn and Manhattan. Great value, too!

When we checked in, the room's toilet didn't flush and the sink took minutes to drain. The sink was never fixed, and we were additionally charged for mini-bar items that we did not take.  Having just arrived in the city, we went up to the room to drop our bags off and freshen up before heading out to meet local family for dinner. Unfortunately, the inoperable bathroom prevented any freshening-up and delayed our plans. (Lest you think, dear reader, that I was the cause of the clog, let me assure you that the first attempted use of the toilet was a purely liquid affair. Upon that initial flush attempt, the bowl filled with water and a q-tip worked its way out from the drain pipe and into the bowl. Gross.)  We called the front desk to report the issue, and they said they would send someone up to look at it. Twenty minutes later, with no word from the staff, we had to leave to make our dinner plans, and on the way out the front desk said that they didn't know when they would fix our room but if the problem wasn't fixed by the time we got back, the desk could arrange a room move for us.  When we returned later that evening, the desk told us everything was fixed, but the sink didn't drain any faster, and it was only barely usable. The toilet at least did work.  I have better things to do on a weekend trip to New York than move hotel rooms in the middle of the night or get angry at hotel staff; for a two night stay, well, the damage had already been done.  Finally, the mini-bar charge appeared on my credit card a couple days after my stay. I called the hotel to have it refunded, and they obliged, naturally. But at this point I can't say that I was surprised.  Pros:  + pretty cute design  + good coffee in the attached bakery  Cons:  - inoperable bathroom  - not clear that it was actually cleaned between guests  - unclear what you're paying for if not the staff to do that very cleaning

Large but intimate space. Not your typical hotel lobby bar.  Somehow concrete  pillars were made to look warm.   lots of seating for groups.  The drinks are NYC  priced but good.  I enjoyed  the crispy  Brussel sprouts  with gribiche (if you've  never heard of it it's  delicious)  despite  its creaminess it does not have milk.

I was happy with my stay here. The room was comfortable, very nicely designed, and equipped with what I needed. Only downside was that the shower didn’t really get hot enough for my taste. Enjoyed my stay and would stay again.

I feel like this newly opened hotel is still finding it's footing, but it still holds up to the Ace brand. Every element is deeply connected to the design, from the gorgeous entrance to the "mission-century modern" furniture, it feels like a movie set from an unknown mishmash of eras. Wood and concrete surround you, rooms are equipped with record players and guitars, and the staff is warm and friendly.  It's missing some of the touches I'd expect from a hotel of this caliber. For example: hot water kettle in room but no tea or coffee; adorable SMEG mini fridge, but no bottled water. Two hair dryers for some reason, but very few toiletries (I'm a fan of the bulk bottles attached to the wall - more environmentally friendly!). Our TV wouldn't turn on and the remote was covered in a sticky substance but "engineer" Johnny was fast and incredibly helpful to get us all fixed up. The hoodie robes are a great element for staying cozy and the room was beautiful.  All in all a great stay and a good addition to the NYC hotel scene.
Great spot, good prices and clean rooms. Decor is contemporary, decent bar in the lobby. Staff pleasant and accomodating.

I’ve stayed and/or played at more than a few Ace Hotel properties (Seattle, LA, Manhattan, London, New Orleans) and I can say that this new Brooklyn Property is my current favorite. Brand new construction w/ a custom build out let them really play around w/ space and the results are absolutely stunning. We stayed in a king room (pictured) and while it wasn’t palatial it was enough room for 2 people to not feel like they were constantly on top of each other. You can hear the subway go by but after a few times you zone it out and honestly you’re in NYC so there’s a million things to be doing that aren’t sitting on a hotel room. Had drinks / food / pastries at their in house restaurant “come as you are” and was a nice addition to the space - creative cocktails and crispy fries are always a winning combo for me.

I was delighted with my recent stay at The Ace Brooklyn. The rooms are large with lots of drawers and hangars to unpack into, and really nicely appointed with some small super cute touches (Smeg fridge mini-bar!).  It is well situated for discovering Brooklyn and the staff are helpful, knowledgeable and pleasant.  Highly recommended!

He had the most wonderful experience here! I surprised my partner with a stay here after proposing, and it was an incredible place to stay. The desk staff was so kind to me when I called in a panic the day before (thank you, Ben!), the room was exquisite, and we had everything we needed in a great central location. We would definitely be excited to stay here again.

Had a nice overnight for my partner's birthday. Wish I knew the restaurant wasn't open yet, but we live in the area and knew where to order from, so not so bad. The bar was great! Great drinks and bartenders. Look forward to going back and experiencing the whole experience, but without a room this time.
Truly enjoyed our stay! Great vibe, attentive front desk and management. Pet-friendly. Ask for a room on the even-numbered side of the hall (6th floor or higher) to get a great view.

Where do I start... This was our first time staying in Brooklyn and it was better than we expected. The Ace Hotel Brooklyn is new and we were in town for a wedding. We were greeted immediately when we arrived at the hotel after an early morning flight. Ben (at the front desk) helped us right away and to our surprise, we were able to check in to our room right away! We had a lot of moving parts this weekend due to the wedding and were a bit needy. Ace met every need. My husband needed an iron on top of the already provided steamer, they had the iron and ironing board in our room in minutes. Our welcome bag from the bride and groom was missing when we arrived, someone personally delivered it to our room while we were at the rehearsal dinner. We needed a late checkout at the last minute to go get Covid tests for our flight, immediately accommodated. Ben at the front desk was a joy and offered us places to eat in Brooklyn and in Pittsburgh for another trip that we are taking soon. And that was just the service!! The rooms were beautifully designed, spacious, and inviting. There's also a vintage photobooth in the lobby by the elevators (+++ in my book, I love photo booths). We weren't able to check out the restaurants because we ran out of time, but we will be back!! Do yourself a favor and check out this property!
We had a fantastic time! The staff, the interior and room - we experienced true excellence. Thank you for your hospitality in its purest form. Mahalo!

The Ace Hotel in Brooklyn is very nice. The public areas are spacious, well appointed, and offer the guests various areas to be convivial, or have privacy. Our room was also very attractive, and met our needs easily. Immediately upon arrival, the front desk staff was welcoming and helpful. We will definitely stay at the Ace Hotel again, on our next trip to Brooklyn.

I would avoid this place.  The staff is pompous and the rooms are below average at best.  Our room was dirty, the HVAC didn’t work, and the mini bar had multiple beverages that were left half full by previous guests.  We called the front desk twice about the HVAC they were unable to fix the problem with in house engineers.  We were never offered a different room.  The hotel could be great but has severe management issues.

My fiancé and I have stayed here about 3-4 times in the last few months for business trips and various weddings and it’s consistently an amazing experience. Similar to what everyone has said, the staff is so nice. Also, the bar is gorgeous. Will be staying here again soon.
Very nice boutique hotel that allows pets! Good vibes great lounge and friendly staff. Food was good as well.  Good stay.
Excellent hotel, excellent location near Macy's, Nordstrom, tj max and many more stores. Service is amazing,  big rooms, great staff. Food is great!! Love it!!

We stayed at the new Ace in Brooklyn recently while moving apartments and used their promo deal so we paid about $300/night. The hotel design is lovely - more spacious than the Manhattan location. Bar is big and a nice spot to get a drink and they had an outdoor cafe we did not use. Obviously, covid has ruined everything so we did not feel comfortable spending too much time in any of the shared spaces. We had a King bed room, standard for NYC but small-ish- had a cute view of the tops of some buildings. Only negative was that on the 6th floor you could feel the rumbling of the train passing by at night. If you are not used to NYC sounds this may annoy you, but overall for the value it was a great find and the only cool hotel in that part of Brooklyn.
Gorg. Lobby is beautiful. You can come to the lobby just to chill,  enjoy coffee or have a drink at the bar. Also has a quiet co working space.
Staff was super nice and helpful from start.  Very funky fun vibe.  I liked the coffee and rum bread in morning too.
I come here for work sometimes and it has amazing lobby/bar and the work space. I would really want to comeback just for drinks and stay a night!!

The coffee they gave me tasted like actual water. I just don’t want anyone else to be as disappointed as me when ordering a coffee and tasting actual water. I’ve also never in my life written a review but this was so bad
DJ in the ground floor bar area, lots of millennials everywhere, good service, quiet upstairs, great breakfast downstairs; what else could you ask for?
Great hotel 👌 excellent service very friendly and clean.. They took time and made every effort to assist me with my situation

Oh forgot to mention the shower issue - you had to turn on the shower to FULL heat for about ~10 minutes before the temperature started to get warmer. I had to take a luke warm shower because I couldn't wait one day. oof.

Absolutely loved this new addition to downtown brooklyn.  It is perfectly located. It has easy access to the subway (2 main stations at just 1-2 blocks away). Also, it is close to bunch of boutique stores, restaurants and cafes on Atlantic ave. You can grab lunch at Dekalb Hall which is just next to Trader Joes and Target (all these, just 2 short blocks away).  The hotel itself is beautiful. It has a modern and upscale 70's vibe with an industrial touch. It has bunch of different spaces to hang out, to seat for a casual meeting or just to focus and work. The bar space is cool and the up coming restaurant looks enticing.  The room had amazing big steel windows. Lots of natural light. It was spacious and thoughtfully decorated.  As a surprise touch, we had some complementary cookies and toasted corn waiting at the room!  The service was flawless. Eager to help and gave us the best experience.  Loved this place. Cannot wait to plan our next stay there!
Best hotel experience in NYC. Friendly staff and nice amenities. Great bartenders. I like that they check vaccination status if you want to use the gym.
Thank you Damien. A very welcoming front desk and 5 star service. Will be back.
Horrible $6 cappuccino that took 15 minutes to make. Skipped my order 3 times to make someone else's coffees. Oh, and no decaf anything. Avoid the "As You Are" bakery!
$ No coffee in room ! But staff was excellent . Suite room is good .
Bathrooms are Amazing. Some of the Best Work I've ever Done...
Very unorthodox Hotel, very urban and unorthodox design, most importantly staff have good common sense which can’t be found in chain Hotels, well done, thanks
Very convenient location .friendly staff.  Small room space but sufficient.
I called this location for a few questions prior to reserving, the receptionist hung up mid-call. Will be looking elsewhere. Unprofessional (basic) customer service.
Really nice bar... A bit pretentious in a way that you don't feel being part of the crowd.
Loved everything about it! Super friendly staff, spacious room, super comfy bed, great decor!
I had a great stay, the hotel has a nice vibe
Extraordinarily accommodating front staff that went above and beyond to make my stay comfortable. Thanks, will be back!
Stylish space and super friendly staff. A great home base to explore NYC!
Visited some friends here. Beautiful lobby and cozy rooms.
Cool place, good looking people and cool atmosphere.
Expansive new Brooklyn hotel. Great lobby bar. Restaurant coming soon.
Dog friendly, great cocktails and a great space to chill.
Great long and bar.
Modern. Friendly staff.
Not happy with their service. Never go there.
It's really beautiful and chic
Cool spot to stay in DT Brooklyn
Nice modern hotel to have in the area
Beautiful and chic!!!
Lit
Five star treatment
Nice atmosphere
Beautiful design!
𝘎𝘳𝘦𝘢𝘵 𝘭𝘰𝘤𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯, 𝘣𝘦𝘢𝘶𝘵𝘪𝘧𝘶𝘭 𝘥𝘦𝘤𝘰𝘳.

The Ace Hotel in Brooklyn was a good short stay for us. The room was clean and surprisingly quiet.  The staff was courteous and polite at both check in and when we checked out.  The location of the Ace Hotel Brooklyn is fairly good.  Close to Downtown and the Barkley Center.  The in room snack bar was simple stuff and way overpriced considering Bodegas are on every other corner. All in all.. a good short stay.

Sustainably-minded, beautiful architecture.  architecture 5-stars, rooms 5-stars, location 5-stars  There aren't a lot of options for people looking for hotels going out of their way to be environmentally sustainable in Kyoto City (as of the end of 2021), but the Ace Hotel Kyoto is doing quite a bit, from reducing plastic, to collaborating with companies and stores that practice sustainable practices, to restaurants featuring upcycled drinks and locally sourced food, even in the stunning rooms I was hard pressed to find plastic usage. And the rooms are very well-designed, stylish, incredibly comfortable, with the best pillows I've experienced from a hotel in Kyoto City (and I've stayed in quite a few). The red brick exterior and variety of shops and restaurants all located at the same location as the hotel and its affiliate restaurants made the destination feel even more worth visiting. I don't have a single complaint about the hotel, it was fantastic. Highly recommend booking to include breakfast because it was phenomenal and the dining area was so cool.

Beautifully designed hotel with fun art work. Spacious rooms, record player excellent, house keeping. The location and building is great, restaurants, shops & facilities very close. Parking is close by with standard pricing but double check the prices, some parks are short term and very exi. The Italian and Mexican restaurant have delicious food. The breakfast is exceptional. The staff are friendly and speak english. One of the best hotels we have stayed in Japan, very comfortable for foreigners.

Stayed in Ace Hotel while on my trip to Kyoto.    The staff greeted when I entered and guided me to the receptionist table. The staff then gave a little explanation and gave a map about the whereabouts of the hotel. The hotel itself has a gym, a cafe  and a restaurant. I then was guided by another staff to the elevator.  As soon as I entered, the room was very clean and they gave us a cookie which tasted really good. There is also a television to watch netflix/youtube for entertainment and also a vinyl record player to set your mood with the variety of music disc they provide. There is also room service if you crave some food and dont want to go out.  It also came with breakfast at the Italian restaurant and overall it was a very good experience.

The best hotel ever.  Nice location, near Shiki-Karasuma station.  Cozy atmosphere.  There is a cafe, Stumptown coffee at the grand floor.  Room is very spacious.  Next to the hotel, there is a shopping mall.

Every detail was professional - from the exterior to interior to staff to room amenities! The first ever Ace hotel in Japan, I was excited to see the place for over a year! Renovating traditonal building, they turned it into such an amazing place (not only the hotel but the restaurants and small shops as well). The hotel was stunning! I also loved the creative works collaborated with the local artists! It is expensive (for me at least) but would be really nice to spend a special day with loved ones.
Popup gastro pub is purely amazing !  The Japanese artdeco room with massive lanternes is a must see and the lamb burger a must eat...

What an amazing hotel and incredible experience! This is my favorite Kyoto hotel by a margin. Incredible design by Kengo Kuma, Stumptown Coffee at the first floor, great space for chilling, studying and working and what more? Amazing food, perfect location great service and spacious, modern and stylish rooms. Highly recommended!!

Beautiful hotel and very modern with fine touch of Kyoto tradition. Staffs are all very hip and modern outlook compared to traditions that have been in Japan for ages. Went and tried the Mexican restaurant and food was very good and tasty. It's not a very wholesome portion but bear in mind it's very affordable price compared to Japan boutique hotel pricing. They also have an ATM machine as well as Money Changer machine, awesome.  Only flaw I found was no parking place in the hotel and had to look for a nearby paid parking.

Ace Hotel Kyoto is a fantastic hotel. They accept pets, and that's not easy to find here in Japan. I really wish other hotels all over the country will follow suit. All the staff were extremely helpful and friendly all the time, when we left, we were already planning out next visit to Kyoto and Ace.

Great location. Fantastic the way the entrance and patio have been conceived. The retail integration is great and tenant curstion is top. Hotel interior is great in the lobby and messanines, and good generally in rooms and other spaces. All day dining is just ok but their Mexican bar is very fun. Location is very good if you are interested in contemporary Kyoto.
Dog friendly hotel in the heart of kyoto.  Can walk to the river, Gion, and a million restaurants. The staff are super friendly and stumptown coffee right there when you wake up
Great location.  Comfortable rooms with cool fittings such as turntables.  It's on the pricey side and more luxury Japanese hotel than cool and hip Ace hotel but recommended nonetheless
as job. you!
Stylish and hip. Surrounded w a bunch of great restaurants and stores.
An exciting, vibrant hotel. Cool place to stay!
Amazing place great atmosphere and the attention to detail of everything were excellent!

text: (Translated by Google) It's interesting because it incorporates an interesting and pretty young feeling. This time, I used the Mexican BAR on the upper floor. The design is modern rather than ethnic, and it's nice, casual, but the profoundness of the hotel BAR is also produced, so I was able to relax and be satisfied. I had Pina Colada and Ron Sakapa rock. I plan to use it again next time.  (Original)  面白い、かなり若い感覚を取り入れてあり面白いです。今回は上階のメキシカンBARを利用しました。民族的ではなくモダンにデザインされていて素敵、カジュアルだけどホテルBARの重厚さも演出されており、ゆっくりでき、満足できました。ピニャコラーダとロンサカパをロックでいただきました。次回も利用するつもりです。

text: (Translated by Google) Appearance, interior, scent, hospitality  Perfect in everything, it has become my favorite hotel in my life.  Thanks to Ace Hotel, I was able to spend a wonderful time from check-in to check-out without leaving a second.  Casual and polite hospitality. It was the best.  The bakery recommended by the clerk at the attached cafe was also very delicious.  Anyway, it is the best hotel. I will definitely go again.  (Original)  外観、内観、香り、ホスピタリティ  全てにおいて完璧で、人生で1番好きなホテルになりました。  チェックインからチェックアウトまで一秒も余すことなく素敵な時間を過ごせたのはエースホテルさんのおかげです。  カジュアル、かつ、丁寧なおもてなし。最高でした。  併設されてるカフェの店員さんがお勧めしてくださったパン屋さんもとても美味しかったです。  とにかく最高なホテルです。また絶対行きます。

text: (Translated by Google) Ace Hotel Kyoto, a hotel that opened in Shinpuhkan last year.  I wanted to stay at the Goto campaign last year, but I couldn't get it, so I finally came to stay for over a year this month when Corona was calm.  When you enter the front of the hotel, the music is playing at a fairly loud volume, and it has the atmosphere of an overseas resort hotel. It's pretty good for me who doesn't want a Japanese atmosphere in Kyoto! If you have an image of Japanese, you may be a little surprised.  Since the room is facing east, you can see Higashiyama from the window, and it is more of an artistic and fashionable casual atmosphere than a luxurious atmosphere. At night, you can see the illumination of the laser beam of Kiyomizu Temple.  It seems that the facilities are different for each room, but the room I stayed in had a record player. I didn't use it because I avoided dealing with records, but it has an atmosphere.  There is also a large desk, and it seems that it will be quite good if you worcate here.  The rooms have a Japanese atmosphere in some places, and it seems that the concept is a fusion of east and west.  The restaurant is delicious, the atmosphere that blends into Shinpuhkan is good, and it is a wonderful hotel that suits the place called Sanjo Karasuma very well.  (Original)  新風館に昨年オープンしたホテル、エースホテル京都。  昨年のGotoキャンペーンの時に泊まりたかったのですが、なかなか取れず、やっとコロナの落ち着いた今月に1年越しに泊まりにきました。  ホテルのフロントに入るとなかなかの音量で音楽が流れていて、海外のリゾートホテルの雰囲気もあります。京都に和の雰囲気を求めていない私にはかなりいいです！和のイメージを持っていたら、ちょっとビックリするかもしれません。  東向のお部屋なので窓からは東山がバッチリ見えて、豪華な雰囲気と言うよりは、アートでおしゃれなカジュアルな雰囲気です。夜は清水寺のレーザー光線のライトアップが見えます。  部屋ごとに設備などが異なるらしいですが、私の泊まった部屋はレコードプレーヤーがありました。レコードを扱うのを避けたので利用しませんでしたが、あるだけで雰囲気あります。  大きなデスクもあり、ここならワーケーションをしたらかなりはかどりそうです。  お部屋はところどころは和の雰囲気もあり、東西の融合もコンセプトだそうです。  レストランもおいしくて、新風館に溶け込んだ雰囲気も良く、三条烏丸という場所にもとても似合ったステキなホテルです。

text: (Translated by Google) Ace Hotel Kyoto that I had reserved on the opening day of April.  I haven't had a chance since the opening was delayed in Corona and it was canceled once, but I finally stayed.  Considering that the base was the foundation of a commercial facility that used a historical building called Shinpuhkan, the exterior of Kengo Kuma and the interior of the lobby. I think the design was quite difficult.  The impression is that the Shinpuhkan has been renewed to coincide with the opening of the Ace Hotel, and it has improved considerably.  There are pros and cons to the lobby, but I really like it because it has a public feel that Japan doesn't have. Feeling like a free space ◎  Regarding the room, it was a standard twin this time, but it seems to be different, but it may be a little unsatisfactory if you have experienced an American ace hotel.  Since the hotel was originally a local and underground hotel, I felt that it would be okay to bring out the ACE-ness even more in Kyoto.  I also felt that it was a little too simple.  I'm glad I was still playful.  Compared to other foreign-owned hotels in Kyoto, the style and perspective of the hotel itself is different in the first place, so I think that those who know how to understand Ace Hotel to some extent will be familiar with it. I don't recommend it to anyone who wants a luxurious and relaxing trip.  The customer service is friendly and casual, but the "feeling not too crushed" was just right.  Casual customer service is quite difficult to balance.  Meals are served at "Pio Pico" in the bar lounge on the 2nd floor. It's a taco restaurant.  The menu and charm are a little too strong in design and difficult to understand, but I think the taste was relatively good.  Actually, I love tacos and Mexican food and have eaten quite a lot, but in Japan, there are many places that are too modernized to Japan and there are many things that are not enough, but I also liked how to use spices in a well-balanced manner.  Guacamole is excellent.  Probably a simple composition of avocado, olive oil, salt, white pepper and lime, but it was very delicious.  However, I may not recommend beef tacos. It has a savory meat flavor like Mexico or the southern part of the United States, but it was regrettable because it was intentionally rather muscular. I like sauces and spices.  The menu structure is just right when you think of a bar lounge, and as a taco and Mexican food lover, it's pretty easy to use, and I'm sure you'll come back again. It was like that.  If you want to stay relaxed and relaxed, it may not be suitable for many young people because it has a fashionable commercial facility, but if you come to Kyoto for a couple of days for work, it is one of the hotels you definitely want to stay at.  It may not be accepted by everyone, but I like it. text: (Translated by Google) I stayed at Ace Hotel Kyoto, which just opened on June 11.  The first thing that impresses me is the exterior designed by Kengo Kuma in a historic building built in the Taisho era. And a cool interior full of commitment. The whole hotel is one art, and you can feel love and commitment to everything you see.  Although it was not for sightseeing this time, I felt that the location that was directly connected to Karasuma-Oike Station, where you can use the Tozai Line and Karasuma Line, is the most convenient way to enjoy sightseeing in Kyoto.  I stayed in the Standard King room, but what impressed me was the fact that I had a guitar and a record player in the room, and the artwork by an artist in Kyoto. It is a work that feels loose in a good way.  It's essential equipment, but I could use a deep bathtub up to my shoulder, and I liked a reasonably hard bed. It's a detail, but I appreciate that there are many USB charging ports. Amenity is also particular, plastic products are excluded, toothbrush using bamboo, amenity bags are also made of paper.  I am particular about the shampoo, the shoe spatula, and the lamp in the room, but I wanted only one body wash towel. I didn't have one, so I decided to wash myself with a thick hand towel in my room. I would like to improve only here.  You can choose from three types of breakfast, and choose California style. The bread and dessert with plenty of avocado were delicious.  Considering location, price, service and comfort, this hotel is the first choice for Kyoto Stay. Next time, I would like to stay overnight for sightseeing.  (Original)  6月11日にオープンしたばかりのエースホテル京都に泊まってきました。  まず印象的なのは大正時代に建てられた歴史的な建造物に隈研吾氏がデザインを監修した外装。そしてこだわりが詰まりまくったカッコいいインテリア。ホテル全体が一つのアートになっていて、目にするすべてのものに愛情とこだわりが感じられます。  今回は観光目的ではなかったのですが、京都観光を楽しむには京都駅から地下鉄で３駅、東西線と烏丸線が使える烏丸御池駅に直結した立地は最高に便利だと感じました。  お部屋はスタンダードキングに宿泊しましたが、印象的だったのは部屋にギターとレコードプレーヤーが置いてあることと、そして京都の芸術家のアート作品が目をひきました。いい意味でゆる感じの作品です。  肝心の設備ですが、深めの浴槽は肩までつかることができ、そこそこ硬さのあるベッドは好みでいた。細かいことですが、USBの充電口がたくさんあるのもありがたいです。アメニティにもこだわりがあり、プラスチック製品を排除していて、竹を使った歯ブラシ、アメニティの袋も紙製というこだわりよう。  部屋にあるシャンプー類、靴ベラ、ランプ一つをとってもこだわりが詰まっていますが、一つだけ備え付けてほしかったのはボディウォッシュタオルです。持ち合わせがなかったため、お部屋の厚手のハンドタオルで体を洗うことになりました。ここだけは改善いただければと思います。  朝食は３種類から選択でき、カリフォルニアスタイルをチョイス。アボカドがたっぷり乗ったパンとデザートはおいしかったです。  立地、価格、サービス、快適さを考えると京都ステイで選択肢にまず挙げたいホテルです。今度は観光利用でゆっくり連泊したいと思います。

text: (Translated by Google) 2 nights using GOTO.  Very convenient location next to Karasuma Oike Station. It can be used on both the Karasuma Line (North-South Line) and the Tozai Line.  Only under the supervision of Kengo Kuma, this stylish design is a fusion of Japanese and modern.  However, the service is of low quality, as if it were a student circle.  Some points that I was particularly interested in.  ・ The smell of perfume from one male staff member at the breakfast venue was too strong to eat. On the second day, I was guided by the same person, so I asked him to make an outdoor table. Cold. There is no reason why the clerk around me does not notice this smell, so there may be a culture here that makes it good.  ・ At 9:50 am on the second day, hang a cleaning request tag (broom type) on the door and go to a World Heritage Site. I returned to 15:00, but only bed makeup was done, and the garbage on the floor, room service the night before, and used towels remained as they were. I called the "operator" and said, "Cleaning is not completed. I'm tired so I want to take a rest. I'll go out again at 17:00, so I'd like to ask for the rest of the cleaning." I started taking a nap and cleaned it 3 minutes later. I was struck when I came to.  ・ At around 21:00 pm on the first day, when returning from eating out, the doorman (female) receives a signal with a gesture, "Because it is EXIT ONLY, please enter from the opposite side." When entering from the other side, this time, "What is a stub? What is a stub?" Did you think you returned to pick up your luggage at 21:00? In the meantime, a drunken guest boarded a taxi and came in from "EXIT ONLY". The "stub ticket staff" started talking happily with the guests and guided them into the hotel as they were. There was no consistency, security, or hospitality.  ・ When I was getting on the elevator that says "up to 4 people" (to prevent infection), the staff brought a group of 6 people from the lobby.  It seems that it sells "friendly", but it may be mistaken for "sweetness to acquaintances".  You should thoroughly learn the basics of customer service once again.  (Original)  GOTOを利用して２泊。  烏丸御池駅隣接で大変便利な立地。烏丸線（南北線）・東西線ともに利用できる。  隈研吾氏の監修とだけあって、和とモダンの融合したスタイリッシュなデザイン。  しかしながら、サービスはあたかも学生サークルのノリのような低品質。  特に気になった点をいくつか。  ・朝食会場での男性スタッフ１名の香水の臭いがキツすぎて、食事にならない。２日目も同じ人物に案内されたので、野外のテーブルにしてもらう。寒い。周囲の店員がこの臭いに気づかないわけがないので、これをよしとしてしまう文化がここにはあるのだろう。  ・２日目朝9:50に掃除依頼の札（箒型）をドアにかけて世界遺産等に出かける。15:00に戻ったがベッドメイクしかされておらず、床のゴミ・前夜のルームサービスや使用済みタオルはそのまま。「オペレーター」に電話し、「掃除が完了していない。疲れているので休みたい。17:00に再度出かけるのでそれから掃除の残りをお願いしたい」と連絡して昼寝を始めたら、３分後に掃除に来ましたと叩き起こされる。  ・１日目夜21:00頃、外食から戻るとドアマン（女性）に「EXIT ONLYなので反対から入ってくれ」とジェスチャーで合図を受ける。反対側から入ると今度は「半券は？半券は？」と意味不明な文言を連呼される。21:00に荷物でも取りに戻ったと思われたのだろうか？そうこうするうちに酔っ払った宿泊客がタクシーで乗り付け、堂々と「EXIT ONLY」から入ってくる。「半券連呼スタッフ」はその客らと楽しげに話し始め、そのままホテル内に案内。一貫性もセキュリティもホスピタイリティもあったものじゃない。  ・（感染予防のため）「４人まで」と書かれたエレベーターに先に乗っていたところ、ロビーから６人の団体をスタッフが同乗させてきた。  「フレンドリー」を売りにしているようだが、「知り合いに対する甘え」と履き違えているのではないか。  もう一度接客の基本を徹底的に学ばれたほうがいい。

text: (Translated by Google) The Mexican restaurant on the 2nd floor is closed for the whole of March 💤‼ ️  (Original)  2階のメキシｶﾝレストランは3月一杯お休み💤です‼️

text: We saw a concert at the theater - we did not stay at the hotel. The theater is a charming venue and we enjoyed the show we saw. The staff was courteous and efficient in getting us through the security protocols. The restrooms were downstairs and I don't know if there was an elevator - there may be and I just didn't see one so it's worth finding out if mobility is an issue.  The folks at the hotel valet service were great and I recommend them without hesitation.

Old 1920's building with 21st century type rooms. Had a very small room and don't know what the others are like, but this was just fine only staying 1 night. The elevators were a bit difficult to operate as you need your key card to run it and it's not easy to see where to tap your card the first time. Helped a couple others how it worked. Maybe if staff informed guests at check in. ?  Don't expect a 5 star type room, it's not what this place is about. But overall very clean and comfortable. Would I recommend? Yes.  FYI : Nothing to do with the hotel, but parking is very expensive at the lot next door and it's cash only. $40. Bring cash,  the ATM charges a high fee.

I stay at a lot of hotels and this is the worse I’ve encountered. Waited an awful long time for valet as the attendant was sleeping in his car when I arrived. Upon check in I was told the room I booked wasn’t available. Would have been nice to have been notified of this beforehand. The room I initially booked was worth hundreds more than the room i was given. Instead of a refund, I got a $50 food credit! Unable to connect our HDMI cable. Poor food and terrible parking situation.

Though the photos look great, the price is reasonable and seems to have decent amenities, I've Never Been to this establishment, however, Google Timeline insists that I have.  My work sales records prove a different story. Can't sell real property; n Texas if you are in California.

This is my second time coming to this Hotel for a show. All I have to say is that it is one of the most beautiful buildings I’ve been inside of in Downtown Los Angeles. The architecture inside is so detailed and the building is historic.  I went to see She & Him this last time and the acoustics inside of the theater are clear for where ever it is you get to sit.

I’ve stayed in the Ace hotel in different stores cities. This was my first time in the one in L.A. and I am puzzled to see the good reviews. The rooms are awfully small, there is no door on the shower, the carpet is a poop beige colour, the chair is like a public middle school one, there is no paintings on the walls but instead exposed sheet rock and there is rust and mold. Photos speak for themselves. Not sure what is the decor angle: homeless chic?  Reserved a King room and was given a queen with the promise “that you have the best room in the hotel”.  The rooftop is open the the public, and let me tell you: what a dodgy crowd. I felt borderline unsafe in my own hotel. Ghetto Doesn’t begin to describe the crowd.  They seem to mix all in in one bucket with awful results: zen palms springs+DTLA hipster+hippity hoppy club crowd but don’t hit the mark at any.  Giving 2 stars for the staff being super nice and the room being daily cleaned. Avoid.
Visited the rooftop restaurant and it was perfect to celebrate bringing in the new year! Had a great vibe, great music, and the service was awesome! Will definitely recommend!

I wasn’t expecting to stay here but they had a weekend rate nobody could complain about. I was feeling sad and I was alone but the staff was so sweet at the check in counter everyday and night. The space is beautiful and there are plenty of things to do inside and around the hotel. The rooftop bar was fun on a Friday night and the pool is heated which was perfect for morning swims when things are not as busy or loud.

If you want to sleep -which is what we wanted when we booked a hotel-, try a different one since they will have rooftop parties and won't be able to offer you a different room. Also, it felt like the staff had no intention whatsoever to help us. Such a pity, it could be a great hotel but it isn't.

Honestly one of the worst hotel experiences I've ever had - bad service, uncomfortable bed, and so noisy that sleep was all but impossible.  My wife and I stayed here for a friend's wedding and had a less than great experience.  The hotel room was oddly laid out with the bed up against and facing the outer wall and windows and there was no sound deadening at all between the room and the outside world.  Being in the heart of downtown, the cacophony of noise emanating from the street was constant and extremely loud, making sleeping soundly an impossible feat.  After the first sleepless night, we asked the front desk if there were ear plugs available.  We were told that they had ear plugs for guests, but that they didn't have any available at the desk and that they would have Housekeeping bring up a couple pairs, which never happened.  Later that evening we once again asked the front desk for ear plugs and was told that Housekeeping would bring some to us, but once again nobody ever came.  The hotel itself was also not what I was expecting for a boutique hotel at its price point.  The rooms were spartan and industrial.  The mattress was unsupportive and uncomfortable.  There was no full-sized ironing board (just a small table-top one) which made getting ready for the wedding we were attending a challenge.  At least our room had a door for the bathroom though as our friends who stayed there did not.

They wouldn’t let us check into our room until 530pm so we had to wait around the hotel ruining our afternoon plans. Then after barely even being in our room they charged me with a Mini bar fee even though we didn’t take anything from the room.

Unlike the cookie cutter hotels, the ACE DTLA has its unique charm and beauty. It is an old art deco building so the rooms are small and you won't have the conveniences of a new hotel. The front desk staff and bellmen were very friendly and welcoming. The valet guy could be more attentive and helpful. We arrive in our car but were going to across the street so didn't need valet. He just stood there while we got all our luggage out, then he opened the door for us while we dragged all out stuff, I dropped my suitcase and he just stood there. He finally helped me with my carryon while I pushed the bigger suitcase. The bellman was inside, but didn't see us until we were inside. IMO either the valet guy should have called the bellman, or the bellman should walk outside from time to time to see if there are guests arriving.  After checking in, we went up to the room and it was a bit dark. Simon the bellman suggested we go ask for another room, and Michael upgraded us to a nicer room. We had a king bed corner room with a balcony with 4 big windows. It was a super nice upgrade!  PROS for me:  1. Great location in downtown LA.  2. Hotel style (decor, building)  3. Good quality mattress, pillows and bedsheets/comforter  4, Eco conscious - small hand bar soap (less waste) and refillable shampoo, conditioner and body soap  5. Big windows - lots of lights  6. Rooftop bar is cool and not too big so more intimate  7. They clean your room only if you request it the day before so you they won't bother you trying to get in your room at different times like in other hotels  8. Very nice and good quality assortment of snacks, and drinks - coconut water, Topo Chico, nice brand chips, etc.  9. No carpet in the rooms!  CONS:  1. Hallway paint color and carpet is very dark, depressing and old looking.  2. Rooms are small and there's not much space to put your big luggages, small closet and no drawers to put your things  3. Restaurant menu is average, not great.  4. Bathroom tub /shower was elevated and there was no handrail or anything to hold on to when getting out. I suggested to the hotel to put something, someone can slip if not careful.  One thing that I found odd s that I called the day after we checked out because I thought I had left a dress. They said housekeeping didn't find anything left behind in the room. Later I found it among my stuff and called back to let them know I had it. That night, I realized we had indeed left a bottle of wine in a gift bag that my boyfriend received as a birthday gift. But they didn't say anything about it. I found it odd that they wouldn't report that, especially when we checked out at 1pm and left our suitcases with front desk until 7pm. Housekeeping certainly had cleaned the room and could have notified the front desk. I am not certain of hotel policies of forgotten items, but I'd think they would attempt to notify guests in case it was forgotten and not left behind knowingly.  Overall we had a great stay and experience.  We celebrated a birthday in the rooftop bar and Michael the assistant manager had a list with all our guests so they could all go on the hotel guest elevator for quicker access instead of the public rooftop elevator. That was very a very nice touch.
This is a nice hotel. I think for the price is right. But don't expect too much. Also the view from north side is much better than south. So if you want to get a better view ask for north or west.

It’s a guilded mess. Does so many little things wrong that my stay turned sour.  - The rooms are small and designed so the shower steam leaves a stench in the room for hours.  - Front desk is slow.  -The cleaning is not regular and is difficult to books.  -charged me for minibar, and I had to call back several times to get refunded  - cardio gym equipment is broken or dilapidated.  it’s not the worst hotel, but the quality and cleanliness is insulting for the price.

Giving two stars for its location, but that’s about it. If you’re not a sensitive sleeper or if you can sleep with the bar noise happening past 1:46 am please choose this hotel. We stayed in higher level floor and during the weekends, they have super loud blasting music throughout the night. Even after I complained to the front desk, it didn’t seem like they were turning it down. If you’re planning to be out all night maybe it could be a good choice for its location I guess. I’d never come back to this hotel when I have so many other choices in DTLA for similar price.
I work events that the Ace theater best door. Great place. The hotel has a rooftop with a pool dj drinks and good on the weekend there's a long line to go up there and chill.
When I checked in, Michael was Great! He Even gave me the floor I wanted to stay on. Really appreciate him and Matte' for their Service. Made my experience the Best.
Great service and beautiful rooms! Definitely worth staying. Reasonable rates. When you’re visiting California this is the place to stay!
Boucer didn't let us in. Party of 6+ and brought new guests to experience something new and literally lost a regular. Was 12:30 and didnt let us in. Horrible experience.

Stay somewhere else.  Uncomfortable beds, terrible pillows, no room amenities (other than two small boxed waters) and robes that might as well be lined with sand paper.  Oh and it’s not detailed anywhere, but the restaurant is shut right now so don’t expect any room service.  I should have stayed at a Marriott.
The theatre was unbelievable! Has an awesome powder room next to the ladies restroom on the bottom floor. Great experience!
Great on-site parking (valet), restaurant, bar, room design and team working here. Looking forward to staying again soon.

I've been here several times already and the experience has always been pleasant! Their staff were always attentive to the guests and would always smile whenever you pass by. Also, the interior and lobby are nice, modern and classy, it is a good place to sit, sip a cup of tea while reading a book or chat with friends. Everything is worth your money. One of the nicest places we stayed in. We'll definitely come back!

From the beginning we were greeted kindly. The have a cafe on the 1st floor and a rooftop restaurant. The view was nice with architecture to admire. When we entered our room it was warm and welcoming. The pillows had real feathers and the bed was comfortable. You sleep like an angel. With all this said i will be back to enjoy my time in LA.

My girlfriend and I chose this hotel for our first time stay in and I can happily report that we made the right decision. The hotel was having some minor renovations done during our stay but that did not stop us from enjoying every second of it! The customer service was fantastic, the rooms were modern and cozy, the amenities were great, and the attached Starbucks certainly helped us get up and moving in the morning! We absolutely loved our trip and can’t wait to go back, and I assure you we will definitely be booking here again.

Rooms are really small, I even upgraded to a larger room but cool! The pool situation is a little complicated right now so double check with the front desk before making plans. The rooftop is nice but you need reservations. Parking lot is public, but not too expensive. Our hallway floor was pretty run down and there were cleaning supplies left out for a few days. Coffee shop was good and the front desk agents were nice.  4 stars because it wasn't worth the price, you can stay elsewhere for $100 less a night.
Saw Dodie here in concert. Such a beautiful theater!
Impossible to sleep. Windows have no sound isolation. Very noisy rooms

Location was great as well as the overall aesthetics and cleanliness of the hotel. The on-site bar, coffee, and rooftop pool make for great amenities as well. The parking is horrendous, with two off-site location. If you are interested in going in and out of the garage after hours you need call the hotel to be let in, that’s if they pickup. If you’re wheelchair bound/have accessibility needs I would not come here. The other minus is the housekeeping “misplaced” some items of ours during the stay-have yet to hear from anyone at the hotel regarding a follow up or ways to remedy this.

Extremely friendly staff, comfortable and spotless rooms, delicious food and great wines all together in a beautiful setting are enough reasons to come back and to recommend the place to other people. Thank you for making our stay really memorable and keep on doing the same way! We are already planning our next trip, so see you soon!

A perfect place to have fun and relax. All of my frustrations were gone now! Thanks to this place for the nice assistance. It was a relief on my side to stay at this glamorous hotel. Their wonderful and affordable service was strongly recommended! It was a nice experience for me for the first time. I will surely come back!

Aside from the amenities and the staff being super professional I wouldn't stay here again. At night I heard everything from outside. I was on the 10th floor and the windows have no sound proofing what so ever. I heard almost every conversation that was happening either at the rooftop or from the streets. The windows can't even open. I don't know if this is a violation of code in cancelling the noise pollution from outside or what not. They were kind enough to bring earplugs but that shouldn't be necessary.

No reservations needed.Rooftop dining. First come first serve. It's two restaurant sides and two different menu's. The bigger side has more options on the menu and more expensive but it's reasonable prices. A rooftop pool is in the middle . Definitely will be back.🔥
We left the Westin and came here. No reservations but the staff took care of us. Excellent hotel. Rooftop dining was exquisite. I highly recommend 🎉💯

I am in the city for a conference, and I stayed in this hotel. The place is huge, and the ambiance is classy and elegant. The staff and employees were very friendly, polite, and hospitable. Their rooms were roomy and spacious. I had the best view since I stayed on the 10th floor. The menu at their restaurant was amazingly delicious! I will definitely be back here along with the kids because they will surely love the place, especially the pool!

Great location at the same time very low key and awesome staff. I was here for 2 nights . Love the Room layout. Most comfortable beds and sleep. The dimming lights perfect for setting the mood👍👍. I've been in most buildings/hotels/apartments/lofts in dtla & This is now my favorite place to stay.
The theater at the hotel was phenomenal and great!

How fortunate I am to be able to stay in such a beautiful hotel! I spent three days here last week. When I stayed here, I was so happy and impressed with the experience I had. I thanked your staves for their professional treatment of me. Guys, please keep up the good work. Before next time, take care! It comes highly recommended!
Killer theater, great roof top, rooms a little bare yet the suites are quite nice.

So far, I always have a good and remarkable stay at this hotel for many years. Location is still the best, foods on breakfast and dinner were great, and the staff was all exceptional. They have beautiful gardens and beachfront location. The room and much of the facilities are updated and well-maintained. I highly recommend this hotel.

It was our first time staying at this hotel with my family, and I can say that this hotel was excellent! Most especially with their amenities like the pool, jacuzzi, and gym. The rooms are spacious and luxuriously appointed. Their staff was very accommodating and friendly. The service was attentive and gracious, and the location was convenient at all. I strongly recommend this hotel!

They serve the best shrimp tacos! They're cocktails are amazing!  And you get to have a beautiful view of Downtown Los Angeles. Last night was my first time visiting since the pandemic started and I liked how it was clean and they kept everyone seated at a distance. You do have to make reservations in advance. Great place to relax and enjoy the view.
I walked by it from the outside it looked very cozy but not arcosian

My girlfriend and I booked a room for one night here for our two year anniversary. Even though we were told prior to booking that we didn’t have to book a reservation for the rooftop, we unfortunately were told upon checking in that we did need a reservation to get access to the rooftop, and they were at capacity for the night. As disappointing as that news was, our minds were at ease as soon as we talked with Gaelin (I think that’s how you spell it?!). He was extremely accommodating and in tune with the situation so that we were able to get a table on the rooftop without a wait. Not only that, but he made us feel like our concerns were valid in not having access to the rooftop as guests. He was easy to talk to and overall was able to rectify our situation,  which turned our stay into a positive one. Kudos to Gaelin!
Just leaving a review to say how much I miss this place after moving! Best bar/wait staff in downtown LA ❤️
Bad light in bathroom, noise from outside was loud, bed wasn't very comfortable. Pretty inside with boho vibe.

Your workers helped us make it that way. Next year we will be back. When we casually mentioned that it was his birthday, they shocked my husband with a slice of chocolate cake with "Happy Birthday" written on the plate. It was amazing, our star. We had a wonderful holiday and stayed here. Highly suggested!
Beautiful hotel, beautiful pool, great views, cute & friendly barman! What's not to love?!

I have had great times pre-COVID years. The rooms are ok. Not really my type for the price. "The Upstairs" Rooftop Bar and Lounge is nice to be at. There is a very, very small swimming pool there as well. Sometimes LIVE events are entertaining to see and experience. For now it is only reservations until this pandemic is over. All in all, I would visit the place and as for staying as a hotel guest, I would only if I can get a decent discount whenever possible. Did I mention, Hollywood celebrities like to stay there once in a while? It's a hotel in Los Angeles and it is bound to happen!

Never written a review for a hotel before I checked out before, but here I am. In LA on business and needed a place downtown, I'm overjoyed I picked this place. First time here and it's probably one of my favorite hotels I've ever stayed in.  This place is just oozing with charm. The somewhat untraditional arrangement of the room is done with intention, and ends up being a very effective use of space. Plenty of room for a huge (comfortable) bed, a lounging area, and a workspace with ample power connections and lighting.  The feel of the place is an interesting combination of modern and retro, having the effect of feeling very... chic, while retaining the charm of a historic building. The building was actually the tallest in Los Angeles for a year after it was built in 1927, originally for an oil business.  Staff is super friendly, the hotel itself is quiet, comfortable, and I think I see folks with pets which suggests it's pet friendly. Wifi is snappy and free.  Location is superb! Lots of great bars and restaurants super close in any direction, and there's a small convenience store on the corner if you want to pick up snacks and drinks and such.  No coffee maker in the room takes a star away. Most people may not care, but as someone who tends to avoid human contact of any sort before being caffeinated, it's the only real negative I have.  Awesome hotel. It'll be my go-to next visit for sure.

The Ace Hotel is a mixed culture gem in the heart of downtown Los Angeles. Stately older building, but with a mid-century irreverent hipster Edge to it. It is heavily themed around music with record players, vinyl and musical instruments in each room. The beds are comfortable and the rooms are spacious. Even with its old-world charm, there's a European light-heartedness. It's as if the Ritz-Carlton were a bed and breakfast at a chalet in Switzerland. We ordered from the restaurant and the food was delicious, and in the morning the coffee was absolutely amazing. Living in a city like Los Angeles for the coffee options are never ending, this was one of the best espressos I've had this year! The staff was very pleasant, lighthearted and they even delivered a hard to find audio cable when we could not find one at any of the local stores. Huge windows with expansive views, beautiful sunsets and City Lights capped off a beautiful pandemic night in the city. Thank you Nathan and the Ace Hotel! (TP♡}
Amazing location, but got super hot and humid from all the people

Loved staying here. It's a great, little hotel with a pleasant ambience, cool styling, great location, and staff that makes your stay easy and pleasant even during COVID.  It's important to note that the Ace Hotel is literally right in downtown Los Angeles; the second most populous city in the United States. There will be noise outside almost 24/7. There are some sketchy spots nearby, as well, but thankfully they are few and far between. That being said, those are concerns for any hotel/motel/inn you could book in DTLA that you should keep in mind.  That being said, Ace has a LOT going for it. First and foremost the building. The United Artists building is gorgeous. There's a lot of charadcter an detail to be seen. Like the walls in the lobby have been painted plat white and had pop culture sketches drawn on them with pencil. And the presence of the old mail chute running next to the elevators. I would have loved to see the theater but, understandably, that was closed due to the pandemic.  They also have a gym on the fourth floor which was useful. They have a cable machine, dumbbells, elliptical, stationary bike, treadmills, a punching bag, and a few other pieces of equipment I will say I honestly didn't really use. It's not a full gym experience but it's more than enough to keep up a bit of an exercise routine during your visit. Keep in mind that currently (May 2021) require you to make a reservation so they can help keep potential of COVID spread down.  I also loved the room. We stayed in a medium king for a full week and never felt cramped. Truth is that we likely could have gone with a smaller room and still been comfortable. We had all the amenities we needed (shower, toilet, iron & ironing board, desk, wifi, TV, and bed). I would have liked a softer mattress, but I still got a good night's sleep.  Next we have the locale. It's very hard to find a better location than the Ace. You're in the heart of the city making food, drinks, and shopping accessible by foot in every direction. The fashion district is just a couple blocks away, as is Little Tokyo and the Toy district. For food and drinks you can head on up to Upstairs, grab a coffee in Best Girl right next to the lobby, or pick any of a plethora of great dining options nearby. We became partial to Zinque, DTLA Ramen, Dankness Dojo, and Umami Burger during our stay. Also, it's conveniently less than a block away from a CVS, in case you forget to pack anything essential.  The folks working the front desk were friendly and helpful; always ready with answers, recommendations, and assistance. Ask them about the bikes if you want to get around on two wheels during your stay.  Bottom line: this is a great hotel to stay at. Next time I find myself staying in downtown Los Angeles I'll definitely be returning to the Ace.
I just said, The Ace Hotel was Amazing! Thank you, all for the GREAT SERVICE!!!

Hotel is in a great location downtown. Perfect if you are seeing a concert at the venue next door. Customer service was excellent. Staff were helpful and attentive. Valet worked quickly. Rooms were clean, but the layout and decor are interesting. The rooms are not exactly what you'd expect for the price. However, it is a unique experience. TV is beside the bed, which makes it difficult to watch in a comfortable position.

The main dining room remains formal, the food is exquisite, and the service is still astounding with just the right combination of thoughtful and well-trained staff. We have enjoyed many milestones here, and it is definitely worth the try!

Lovely stay... you can hear some of the street noise, but overall a comfy stay. I enjoyed their personal branding when it came to the towels and bathroom toiletries (which you can also buy in their lobby). The bathrobes were a nice touch as well. Aesthetically, if you're into the urban/industrial feel with that hipster kick, this is the hotel for you. Would stay here again!

I am highly disappointed to be making this negative review but I have to warn future guests that there are NO hotel slippers. There is no valet for parking either and it seems that room service is not functioning. 3 hour wait for water and towels, hydration is a serious matter and a human right. Rooftop/restaurant dining was refused although we were guests of the hotel for two nights, we were forced to leave the hotel to source sustenance out of desperation. The Valentine’s Day package was the only thing that was delivered promptly but unfortunately consisted of only vodka and orange juice. (??)  The hotel experience was more like that of a hostel and I would not recommend staying in this establishment.

Great boutique hotel in the fashion district. Came here only for one night: Bed was comfortable, decent (but small) gym, good breakfast. Located in a good spot with easy access. My only gripe was that the room felt a bit “industrial” and not as welcoming as I hoped. Didn’t get a chance to visit the rooftop pool but it looks nice from the photos. Overall, a fun place to stay when you’re in the city.

I love the ACE downtown.  I spend a lot of time traveling and have general anxiety about the way properties are advertised versus what they actually are.  The ACE downtown is QUIET which is really really weird considering it's downtown.  The beds are super comfortable...like I was trying to figure out the brand so I can by the mattress and the sheets.  The property is painfully cool, and unlike other places run by hipsters who are rude, these hipsters are super kind.  If I'm in LA, I'm at the ACE downtown.

I had only stayed one night but overall it was a great time. The rooms were clean and unique, with a nice view of the city life below. I never had the chance to experience the rooftop bar or the theater. I gave a 4/5 because at 8am someone knocked on my door and had me panic. They left before I was able to answer so I am not sure if it was staff or a random. I feel the shower could have been better as well, but that could just be a subjective.  Be sure to check out the Banksy piece across the road!

We were photographing a wedding nearby and our couple booked two rooms here to get ready in. Such a great unique place! One of the rooms was a corner room with plenty of windows and natural light and even a cute little balcony. Everything is picturesque, the design and style is very cool and the staff was very nice.

I've been to the hotel for the last four years for an appointment, and this hotel manages an appointment well. The lunch lines are very well organized, the buffet is set up beautifully, with very tasty food. The conference halls are nice. I certainly would recommend this hotel for sure!
good little nice hotel, has an old vibe to it
The smallest rooms ever!!!!! I've seen small rooms in Paris France but my lord these are small. Rooftop bartenders are rad.
Perfect for a short stay if you're seeing a show here...

Had a GREAT time.  Roof Top bar was delightful. Drink and dinner in the restaurant were good and service excellent.  The show at the theatre was amazing.  Venue SPECTACULAR, so happy this beautiful building has been preserved.  We'll definitely be back.
This hotel was beautiful, clean, conveniently located, and the staff was phenomenal.

Very nice stay at this super trendy DTLA hotel. We stayed here because we had tickets to a show in the theater that is part of the hotel building. Terrific service from check in to check out. The roof top bar has a stunning view of the city and the drinks are delicious.

Although the team working was extremely friendly and the hotel very clean, I would not recommend staying here again. I would not consider myself to be a picky sleeper but I found the mattress to be awful! I was also disappointed that when I sent a survey from Ace Hotel about my stay, I did share my feedback but there was never any follow up or receipt of the feedback received. I would keep looking for another place to stay.  Also as a heads up the self parking is several blocks away (no valet due to covid). However there is a street lot about 100 yards ish away. I think it was $20 for 24 hours.
Roof top lounge was dirty looking just like the neighborhood

I love this old interesting theater but if you have issues please be sure of where you'll be seated as there are stairs and stairs.  In spite of that I always invite other to see the wonderful architecture.  The Opera that evening was or seemed experimental both for them and me.  Enjoyed the evening.  Staff very polite and hospitable.

The night I went, it wasn't too crowded. I wasn't staying as a guest, just there for drinks. The place has a nice ambiance and the rooftop is a nice setting. Overall casual vibe, and even the pool is open. The crowd is mixed, both with people staying at the hotel and people just visiting. People were friendly and bar service was quick. It was a good night.

Pow, POW. Stellar views, even if you're looking st the gorgeous art decor Edison Clock. It was my first time. The house whiskey and beer are the way to go.  Though it slips my mind, our waitress was nice enough to keep her services up with us. We moved into the heater area shortly afterwards. I highly recommend it.

I couldn't have been happier with the service! Lovely hotel, very clean and modern rooms. The waitress was friendly and efficient. The restaurant has large windows that look out onto some trees making it a lovely view to enjoy while enjoying the food and wine. What a nice place, guys! It was an excellent service! Highly recommended!

Ace hotel is a complex with great events, a mediocre restaurant, a nice rooftop bar with w tiny pool. It can be wonderful on an afternoon and absolutely packed and dreadful on a Friday night. Rooms are nice but small. Staff is generally good. Depends on when you go... For a weekday afternoon drink the roof is perfect.

Room was clean, location was great, staff were wonderfully helpful people, and the best girl breakfast was fantastic (thanks for the discount!).  We stayed in a medium-sized room on the 13th floor and enjoyed the view! The room was great and the bathroom was fantastic! A bit loud at night with the rooftop bar above but not terrible (earplugs recommended if you want to get to bed early - is nice and quiet in the morning though for sleeping in).  Would definitely recommend when coming for a show or to be near the area. Parking is onsite (we used valet) and then you don't have to worry about getting to the venue for showtime as it's right downstairs.
Very cool Hotel... !!!  Great food... !!!  Great service... !!!  ❤️❤️❤️

Love when my job puts me in this hotel on work trips. Really great experience almost all the time, but it seems like they have a bit of a front desk employee turn around lately, so sometimes it can be difficult to check in quickly. Amenities are great, with a nice restaurant and lounge.

Mostly everyone at this hotel was extremely nice and helpful, especially the valet! The people working the valet were so kind! The girls at the front desk were really rude to me and it was disappointing. I was confused and asked questions and they must have been annoyed by me (regardless it’s their job to help) and I couldn’t believe how mean And defensive they were to me. Overall the hotel is a cool experience with a very “LA tourist like” Vibe. I’m a local from Orange County and go to LA a lot for work, and there are other places that are nicer with more affordable prices. This is a cool place to experience at least once, but other than that, there are Nicer places with better staffs in LA.

The hotel and building itself are very unique and quaint. However, the service was seriously lacking during my stay. Our reservation was made two months before our stay. We arrived three hours after our check in time expecting to comfortably go up to our room. Instead we were met with “sorry we don’t have any rooms available right now” We were then offered a queen instead of the king that we had initially paid for. This is not acceptable service for the price paid. After a bit of back and forth they were finally able to find us a room. If you are looking to stay in downtown LA there are plenty of other hotels at the same price point that I would look at before the Ace Hotel  UPDATE: I was contacted and compensated for the issue. The manager was understanding and sympathetic to my situation.

We went to the rooftop bar on a last minute whim and had a great time relaxing by the pool. Great music and eclectic crowd. Drinks were pretty good although the jacuzzi looked suspiciously cloudy. Will definitely come back and will be a great spot to bring out of town guests.

This hotel offers you a great service, their rooms are very pleasant and comfortable to stay with. They also have a swimming pool and bars inside the hotel. It was an elegant and affordable hotel in town!

Went for NYE 2019. If you're trying to get to the rooftop bar, go to the entrance on the right of the downstairs restaurant / bar. Took the elevator to a cozy three room party space. The whisky cocktails were tasty. Random music, but good mixed crowd. Would go again.

Beautiful and intentional design/art that you should stop and appreciate given what you're paying :) took Lucy and saw a show nearby, the hotel and the room were incredibly interesting but still comfortable. Broadway smells like @#$& but I genuinely recommend this place!  One issue- front staff will not tell you about price changes so be sure to ask if you make any changes

This was not what I expected but then again really wasn't sure what a minimalist boutique hotel really was! However, loved every thing about it. From the cool lobby with the very friendly reception to the rad elevator signs, awesome bedroom and best snack basket ever ---not that I bought anything , but any place that has Red Vines available and at the ready also has my heart! This was a perfect choice for a quick stay in LA and made going to a concert so convenient and fun. Don't forget to go to the roof top! It's amazing .

Views ok. Housekeeping was pleasant and did a decent job. Central location and great for proximity to things if you're on foot but almost a little too central and chaotic. Front desk staff slightly unprofessional. Self check good idea but doesn't seem to work. High floors are regular hotel rooms but rest of the hotel is a hostel like for European tourists with backpacks..

Great rooftop vibe. A very relaxed and fun atmosphere during the day. Best girl restaurant loves up to its for write ups. It gets crowded but not insane, and the laid back vibe resonates through the place in the best way. A recommended downtown visit, especially if you're thinking about their "golden hour" or " don't call it a happy hour".

Excellent staff that paid attention to details. Thier system of knowing your name and what you prefer works very well. The decor is urban renaissance chic with modernism added very nicely done. The rooms are spacious and are well appointed. I loved the Martin guitar in my room. Rooftop bar and dining area is great.
Very comfortable. Love the 20s era fixtures in the rooms. Had a great view. Pretty safe area

The rooftop bar has two sides. One side has comfortable seating and a fire place, the other side has a Jacuzzi and lounge chairs. The bar is in the middle connecting both sides inside of an art deco tower. Sometimes they have live music. Great views of downtown, a lot of space to roam around. Bar area can get very crowded but not to bad as there is multiple places to order drinks from.

Went to the theater here for a live show. Critical role live. It was hands down the best experience I've ever had in a theater. I thought the interior was absolutely beautiful. The sound was great for the talking head format of the show that I saw. Whatever you happen to see at this theater, it's a beautiful venue, and highly recommended. Parking costs about $10. And you'll only have to walk about a block

Went to the hotel not for housing but rather for a music show at the Ace Theatre, adjoined to the building. An amazing show and an amazing venue! By far the most historic and striking venue I've ever had the pleasure of attending a show in. Incredible classical / Gothic design, good sound, and good staff. There were some rowdy people that wouldn't turn their phone screen off during the show and they were quickly addressed by the staff which I was impressed by. Would love to see another show here.

No hot water, couldn’t take a bath or shower. Overcharged me for my room, didn’t respond to my emails or phone calls for adjustment. Hard to go to a hotel when they don’t follow through with the promise they make you as far as your bill goes. No guest should have to chase down the hotel they just checked out of, to rectify the bill. That doesn’t make for a good follow up experience, and does not help build trust between client and hotel, even if the hotel is charming and has a nice rooftop pool and bar.

We went to the rooftop bar, and the weather was great. The lines at the bar were not long, and there was a nice pool. No one was swimming, but it looked really nice. The bar wasn't too crowded either, we found seats rather quickly as well. Liked it, would come again
