The view from the rooftop bar is great. The pool is just big enough to accommodate a decent sized group without being too large for the space. The drinks we had were good including a spicy margarita.

Was not a guest. Went here for drinks on the rooftop. Good service and good views. It wasn't crowded at around 6:30pm on a Friday, but it was Coachella weekend. I'd return. The drinks from the menu weren't spectacular, so I might get a standard cocktail next time.

Love to have drinks, small plates and a quick rooftop pool dip on a warm winter, spring, summer or fall day!  The theatre is it’s own animal! It’s gorgeous, large yet intimate!  Love both and do will you!

This picture is pretty much the entire "medium" room. While it has an interesting vibe and decor it's extremely pricey to just look hip. There are close hotels that are far nicer with more to offer for the same price. (But they don't have as much style.) The staff was great. Very friendly and helpful. The restaurant is worth a meal and Upstairs is cool. All in all its a very cool spot.... just be prepared to pay for cool

Very friendly staff. It has a very LA hipster feel to it. The bathroom doors slide shut and have no locks, but isn't an issue unless you're sharing a room. It was convenient to have a room here when we were visiting for a late night event at the ace theater.

The rooms here have a great setup and decor (its on the artsy hip and masculine side). Its certainly elevated from your usual hotel. The restaurant looks nice but I've only had drinks on the rooftop - appropriately strong. The design details are really alluring. I'd just say its a bit too pricey but sort of what you expect with current clientele.

Went "Upstairs" to the rooftop bar. Nice vibe and decent drinks. A bit pricey but you are paying for the view. Service was prompt and better than prior experiences. Blankets were a nice touch for the slightly chilly wind but working heat lamps would have been preferred. Overall a great way to introduce some visitors to what hanging out in downtown LA is like.

This is a decent place. Very mellow and a great spot for overpriced drinks that being said you can actually hear yourself think here. So, if you want to actually be able to talk to someone while having a decent ambiance in the background this might... Be the place you're looking for.

Amazing! What a great place! Excellent staff and phenomenal cafe downstairs. The rooftop lounge was gorgeous and offered a peek at the downtown area with a pool to boot! Highly recommend! The upgraded room was very comfortable and offered a clean bathroom and shower area that was separated with a wash area in between. In-room accomodations were on-point! From snacks and drinks to the tv above the bed, I was impressed. My girlfriend and I enjoyed biking through the city on their rental bikes. It made for perfect morning travels to nearby, easily accessible cafes and an indoor food marketplace right down the street! Everything was conveniently located near the hotel and their valet had our car pulled up for out-of-town travel. A perfect stay with a perfect staff! We thank you and can't wait to return!

The rooftop bar was excellent! Great decor, beautiful views, and a fun waitress made our night. It wasn't nearly as crowded as we were afraid it would be at 8pm on a Friday, and the drink prices weren't too bad either.

Very fun rooftop bar, nice restaurant/coffee shop and a fun part of revitalizing DTLA.  The rooms are all a little different and unique.  Definitely a hip style.  The staff is very friendly and helpful.  Really nice location for exploring downtown.

Nice staff! Great rooftop. I know this doesn't mean much but I wasn't a fan of the plastic cups. I ordered a nice bourbon and I don't fancy it in a lunchroom cup. But other than that, the food and atmosphere was great!

I come here every so often with friends just to get drinks at the rooftop bar. It is an awesome outdoor spot with a killer view of LA and they usually have a good dinner on weekends. The mixed drinks are good but not great, if they were this would have been a five star review.

Absolutely incredible experience! We stayed in a super large room that had the coolest understated 70’s vibe and we loved every minute of it. The roof top patio was a pleasant surprise and a super cool vibe at night too.

The rooms are very small. Basically it's just a door and a bed pushed up against the wall with the window.  I paid extra for a room upgrade so I'm not sure what the smaller ones could be like.  The rooftop bar and pool are nice but also quite small. The room amenities are Instagram bait for sure but they're pretty cheap feeling. The walls were very very thin.  I could hear conversations of my neighbors all night. There are so many great options in downtown for a similar price. I would stay at one of them.
Favorite rooftop in DTLA. Amazing food and drinks. Jenna and skyler are the best!!!!😎🤩🤩🤩

I stayed at the Ace Hotel for 4 nights - and I gotta tell you,  it was great. I never slept so well!! The staff are friendly and responsive. The room was not huge, but laid out very well, and felt more spacious than it probably was. No amenity was spared. Loved the vintage accents with record player and cool records to play.

All the workers are attentive, and the hotel looks fantastic. The hotel amenities, including their free breakfast, are also top-notch. In particular, to all my friends and family, I would highly recommend this hotel.

I stayed in a gorgeous studio with balcony on the 6th floor. This place is super dope. The decor is on point. A little 1920s and hipster flair with modern details. The room has a fully stocked snack bar, mini bar and fridge with lots of independent gourmet brands. The room had a record player with a tasteful selection of vintage records. This hotel only has king size beds and they're so freaking comfortable! It was so nice to wake up facing the window. The bartender, Harry, it's pretty cool. He's in a band called Dream Machines and check out his song called Feel It... it's pretty good!
The rooftop patio views are amazing. It can get chilly some evenings but they do have heaters in certain areas. The strong drinks may take some of the chill away. Overall it was a great experience.

Great hipster looking place. Hotel was nice clean, lots of paper to write to a friend and mail back if you're visiting from another country or state. Toilet kept making water noises throughout the night. There were no shower curtains. I think they forgot to provide us with one. They provide shampoo conditioner and body wash in the shower. There's condiments inside the cabinets. You'll be charged if you use them or take them. They do have an iron to iron your clothes. They also have a hair blow dryer. There are robes that you can wear after you shower. The roof top bar at night is nice and you get a good view of the city around you. There's a fire place and music is usually played.

We stayed at the Ace to celebrate my wife's birthday. When we arrived, we were upgraded to a loft. The room was awesome, with a Martin guitar and record player with a stack of records to choose from. We went up to the rooftop to have a drink and enjoy the view before heading out for the night and had bunch in the restaurant downstairs in the morning. We loved our stay and would definitely recommend it!

Small sufficient cozy comfortable pillows nice rest after visiting universal studios. We had a problem with an insect in our bed and we called the front desk. I initially gave this place a one star because when we notified the front desk it seemed like he was concerned but did not do anything else since we were already checking out.

The staff were what made the place wonderful. Comfortable bed and accommodating staff. Short falls for me was the room bathroom. Sliding door that doesn't close all the way, a show head encrusted in scale and like and no shower curtain or glass dividers to keep water from splashing out all over the floor and toilet area. Otherwise comfortable stay, lovely bar and view up top on the roof and great people.

Had a great stay at the hotel; friendly staff and love the industrial vibes. The rooms could be bigger but it's DTLA. Not your average hotel so you're here if you want to be in the scene and enjoy a certain "look". Definitely check out the rooftop bar when you there for the view and good cocktails.

i love this hotel. It's a bit on the pricey side buttt it's beautiful and comfortable. They have great service and I always look forward to coming here. There's also a great ramen place across the way :)

Not feeling this was a good value for a downtown hotel. Staff was friendly and personable, but the gym was not in great shape (machines needed oiling and some TLC) and the bed was just okay--extra low on the floor. Yes it was trendy looking, and the rooftop bar was hopping, but I think my recent stay at the Marriott just a few blocks away was better for me. Elevators were slow. Location was great to catch a show on Main

Food and drink at Best Girl downstairs and up on the rooftop are solid. The front desk was easy to work with for business travelers. The rooms are industrial/loft style, so check the photos on their site to know what you are booking.

It was a very nice hotel. The staff was great. However, the room didn't have a lot of lighting and if you wanted privacy, you have to make or ask for a shower curtain because there isn't one. Overall, it was a good time and located close to many restaurants and bars.

Had a lovely time the concierge was exceptional the service was divine in the environment was better than expected the room is so cozy it's not your typical hotel room it has exposed concrete amazing views the location is undoubtedly one of the best in LA and it goes to say it's worth every single dollar strongly recommend to my friends and family.

Went to The theatre at the Ace Hotel for a movie screening and it was gorgeous. The theater itself was very large with ample seating. We sat all the way in the back and were still able to see the screen clearly. I did have some trouble hearing some parts, but that was probably because people were cheering. My one issue is that there were only 2 stalls in the women's restroom on the balcony floor. With such a large theater, there should definitely be more stalls.

Attended the Linda Ronstadt conversation tour in the theatre of the Ace Hotel. This has been my 3rd event at this venue. It's wonderful because it's large yet intimate. There are no bad seats in this house. The service and for at this hotel are top notch.. And prices are always very reasonable.

Let's start with the good bit. The location of the hotel is very convenient to arrive. I loved the restaurant and coffee place in the lobby. The valet parking and the bell boy taking the luggage to the room was excellent. Rooftop bar was great at happy hour. Great taco stand open 24 hours.

Very hipster and very fun place a rooftop bar is great and often has art exhibits and music. The staff is also very cool and not at all snotty.  police made me feel a little bit like I was in blade runner and a little bit like I travel back to the 30s.

Maybe we were not the right clientele for this place.. Maybe our room was just a bad example.. And maybe my standards of what I expect from a 300$ hotel room are exaggerated - but we were very underwhelmed by our medium room on Floor 9. To me, it seems as if this hotel has not understood the concept of spaces. Our room did not have an actual bathroom, but half the room was a sort of open plan bath area, with no walls, a toilet isolated behind a massive, 4 inch fire safety door that was hard to open or close and no privacy in sight, even the walls were made of glass. Aside from this dedicated bathroom space missing, the room featured a bed that was continuously set between a desk and the wall with the TV mounted on half-height at the food end. Because there was no other dedicated seating space for 2 people, watching TV only was possible from way too close to the screen and sat half-comfortably on the pillows that formed the headboard. If to this description of a room insensitive to spaces you add cheap 2-ply toilet paper and no real solution for bins with bags, then you have maybe an idea of where we expected more from this place. Honorable mentions - great views from the rooftop bar "Upstairs". and a great location close to most night places anyone would find interesting.

Always a wonderful stay at this hotel. Centrally located and close to everything downtown. Quick and efficient valet parking. Great food options within the hotel. Kind and helpful staff. The rooms are always impeccably decorated, minimal, and functional. We had a room with a small patio and fantastic view of the downtown skyline.
Epic theater and historical landmarks. One of the very few places of old Los Angeles. Best experience ever.

Really unique hotel and the restaurant attached has really good food. Parking is not ideal but that's everywhere in downtown LA. This hotel has a unique look and feel. Maybe a little over hipster but they do it right. I felt like I needed to grow a mustache and order and Earl Grey tea or something. I was really impressed when I saw the Rooftop Bar, patio, and pool. Go just to hang out there at least.

Great venue. Very beautiful inside. I have seen many concerts here. Staff is always cool except for a few who harrassed patrons when standing. I drinks were fairly priced for downtown LA. Sound is good in some spots but terrible in others . I would recommend this venue.

Very hipster place in a good way. Rooms look like modern lofts, almost like a converted industrial building. Dog friendly, very cool place with a 50s-60s art deco vibe all over. Great neighborhood for shows, parking does cost.

A friend and I had dinner at the restaurant before going to a concert at the theater that's also part of the hotel. We arrived about 30 minutes before they started serving dinner, but they let us hang out and enjoy delicious cocktails while waiting. The service was great and the place has a nice, laid back atmosphere. Not stuffy or formal but upscale enough to elevate the experience. I had a pasta dish with pesto sauce that wasn't particularly good. It didn't taste bad, but it was very bland. I tried a bite of my friend's rigatoni, and it was really good, so I would go back and either have that or try something else.

Every time I stay at an Ace Hotel, it's fantastic. The rooms are beautiful, it's super comfortable, everyone is crazy helpful, and the rooftop patio is great. There is a venue downstairs, which at times can be a bit noisy, but it hasn't really bothered me much and Norah Jones has to perform somewhere.

Beautiful rooftop bar with great views of LA . Nice restaurant downstairs , I had a great dinner, great decco atmosphere and a great concert venue, I saw Ryuichi Sakamoto there. Awesome. There's also a dance floor. Super cool place

Recently was in Los Angeles with my two daughters on Golden Globe night.  The Ace has the highest standards when you are out of town, you know you are going to have fun there.   If you are looking for a unique out of town experience, look no further!   Great roof top bar and lounge with a panoramic view of downtown.  Beautiful rooms.   Money well spent!

Elegant and comfortable. The venue has an impressive Gothic-style interior. While the ground floor lobby is a bit crowded, consisting of a full bar, merchandise stands, and ground floor seating entrances, there is plenty of other spaces for leisure. There are full-service bars on every floor (basement, ground, and 2 upper levels). Bathrooms are well placed in the basement and upper levels. The concert hall itself is well designed. You'll have a great stage view regardless of your seating. Don't fear the upper level; it the best place to see the impressive design and art on the walls and ceiling.

Didn't stay at the hotel, just went to the ACE theater for a concert. Theater was clean, spacious, and had decent walkways for ease of access. Seating was smaller than it appeared in pictures, but it still worked out for a great view of the stage from many viewing points

It's a bit tricky to get up to the rooftop bar. The entrance is actually at the corner of the building that is next to the taco shack. You will see the Upstairs sign. Enter through that door and take the express elevator up.  I love the view! You can see all the beautiful iconic skyscrapers of downtown.  Drinks: craft cocktails $11 / draft cocktails $12  The Old Fashioned was strong! I was feeling pretty good after one drink.  I like Upstairs a bit better than Perch as there are lots more seating and communal tables. There's also a fireplace and lots of heat lamps to keep you warm.  It's a great place to grab a drink and mingle.  I think if they have a live band it would be perfect place.

We stayed here when in town filming a commercial, the staff was super helpful. They pulled cold brew coffees for us if we were heading out prior to the coffee bar opening and delivered loads of boxes to our rooms. No request went unanswered.  The rooms are typical "Ace Hotel" spaces, on the smaller size but with all necessary amenities and high quality products all around.  Pro Tip: Go to the rooftop bar during happy hour and ask for whatever is "on tap". I was always delighted by their concoctions.

Loved this place. Know what you're getting into, though - this is a hip ass hotel repurposed from the old United Artists theater in downtown LA. Rooms are smaller, with concrete floors and pegboard walls. But they have turntables or guitars, and you can borrow extra music equipment if inspiration strikes. The small lobby restaurant has a great burger and some serious appetizers (try the carrots). Had a great time here. Staff was excellent. I will definitely be back.

Went to the Ace hotel for a friend's birthday on the rooftop. Apparently my group went up the wrong elevator but a nice staff let us through to the top floor. We got situated at a couple of nice couches overlooking the city below. It was a crowded rooftop with little seating but what can you expect from one of the top rooftop parties in LA? Drinks were a bit pricey but the menu and way of labeling the flavors was really creative. Didn't care much for the music but overall it was a good venue for my friend's party!
Never stayed there.  Looked great though.

Weird layout, I wasn't able to find the lobby of the hotel but no matter. Employees from other stores directed me to Upstairs bar. Beautiful bar. Loved the decor and furnishings. Beer comes in a can. Would love to bring someone back for a cocktail. Can be pricy, $10-14 for a cocktail.

We have stayed at Ace hotel in London, NY, Palm Springs and now also, Los Angeles. Like all location is Ace, it’s solid. But this m is for sure the most average hotel experience of them all. We managed to get a good deal at Hotels Tonight that compensate the over all experience considering we didn’t pay their standard price per night. Overall, all rooms at Ace hotel is pretty standard, what you pay for is the whole hotel concept. Just so many Details  they failed on, from; Our room was not ready by the check in time at 3pm, didn’t access our room until as late as 6pm. When we asked for a late check-out to compensate the receptionist said no. Drinks at the roof are made very poorly, take a beer or wine to be safe. The service down the bar and restaurant is also very poor, lack of attention to details. We tried to order some food by the pool, but sadly it arrived cold. When we send it back with the waiter and actually tried the food it was taste less. Rooms are ok, however the cleaning poor and didn’t show up to clean until 7pm one eve just when we got back to our room. With this said, there are nicer rooms in the area which is more value for your bucks.

I booked a medium sized room via GroupOn but upon arrival the room did not seem all that roomy. The room itself was cozy and the layout was very unorthodox which was cool, however, for the price i would have expected a larger room with a better view. Nevertheless the experience was fun and the rooftop had a very chill vibe. The Ace Hotel restaurant on the ground floor had great food and service, it was nice to have everything on site. I would return.

This place was really cool. Probably too cool for me, really, but if the staff thought so they didn't let on. The staff were very welcoming and friendly, and the room was very clean, modern and artistically decorated.  The rooftop evening scene was for a younger crowd (I'm not 40 yet and I was easily the oldest guy up there), and the pool there looked murky enough to conceal a crocodile. Maybe there were too many people in it, but I wouldn't get into that water without getting my shots updated. Anyway, that shouldn't be a deterrent as this isn't a place you visit for the pool. I will be staying here again.

Very impressed with this hotel. The service was attentive and the decor and ambiance are just right for a downtown hotel. Lots of history to this building. The rooftop is a great place for drinks and a view. I stayed in the hotel, which gave me easy access to the rooftop bar. Non-guests need to wait in a long line in the evenings to get to the top. Clientele for the bar are skinny-jeans' wearing hipsters. The only complaint I have about this hotel is that the mattress was not comfortable at all (too hard) and I did not get much sleep.

This place is amazing! Attended an intimate concert for the first time here and I'd love to go again. Plus the rooftop bar is just awesome! Will definitely take pictures to share next time I check it out.

The staff were friendly buy followed their rules (no drinks from outside places including water). The seats in the theater are a bit small. Not a lot of leg room or arm room. The air conditioning works great and the decor is amazing. Everything else is mediocre.

Worst experience ever. Room is very small with terrible sound proof windows. Very noisy street and roof-club music going on. If you simply want a good night sleep, this is not the place to be. Service is good hence the one star.

Fantastic hip hotel in super cool downtown LA. The rooms are very comfortable and the hotel service very good. The rooftop pool and bar are a happening spot. The restaurant, Best Girl, is awesome - some of the best food I’ve eaten.

Went to see Tim and Eric 10th anniversary show at the theatre at the ace hotel. Beautiful venue with great sound. Some of the seats in the back of the wings might not have great views of the stage, but anywhere in the orchestra center is fantastic. We sat around halfway back in orchestra center and had an amazing experience. Try the bar downstairs near the restrooms to skip the (still pretty reasonable) lines at the main bar.

I've been to this venue twice, for totally different kinds of events (film screening and concert), and each time has been fantastic! Thus far it seems to me like they really vet the event organizers to ensure they represent the hotel well rather than just renting out the place to anyone with a check in hand. Keep up the good work, guys! 🤘
Great stay here at the Ace. The staff are all super friendly and the rooms are super cool. Very nice coffee bar too in the lobby. Highly recommend this sport if you're hoping to stay in downtown LA.

I have not stayed at this hotel but I have frequented the bars there many times!  Great food, great drinks and good staff !!  The rooftop bar has a great L.A. feel to it although it can get a little busy at the bar on a Friday night - once you have your drink in hand - you can go out and enjoy the night air and relax!  Give it a shot - you'll enjoy it !

Such a nice comfortable hotel!  Just slightly outside of dtown as to offer quiet and safe outside environment, yet a short walk to reach all the hustle and clutter that dtown offers. The people who work there are upbeat and helpful, critical to any stay anywhere you would want to be.  There is a small but very hip rooftop pool and bar with a DJ spinning...nice for a romantic date and if you’re staying in the hotel, great place to show off your girl/guy or even find one...Ha.  If you’re looking for a good hotel, with romantic features...Stay at the Ace.  Guarantee you will like.

Spent a lovely Sunday afternoon with friends on the rooftop bar. A little sangria, good tunes, soft breeze. Great way to spend the end of the week. No lines and easy to find a place to sit for 5. Need to spend more time there this summer

The inside of the hotel is really beautiful. The restaurant has cool drawings on the walls behind some of the booths. They have a great bar selection and the hotel is located close to some other great restaurants. Service was great, we were just there for drinks and people were friendly and fast.

The location was unexpected. It was almost hidden. I drove right by it and almost missed it. Having said that the hotel and theater were beautiful. It was a great combination of modern and gothic decor. The design was really great and unique. The rooftop bar was extremely cozy. The food seemed a bit pricey, but it is downtown LA, I guess it's to be expected.

Attended for a birthday party at the rooftop bar. Great views, good drinks, and an all around awesome hotel. The theater, which we'd previously been to, is extremely beautiful as well. Worth checking out even if you're just there for drinks.

Anyways the way this hotel is set up was nothing like I've stayed at before. There are four floors in which all the entrance to the rooms face the inside of the building. And the first floor in the middle, is a little lounging area. Entering our room, I was solo impressed with how New and clean everything was. I honestly wasn't expecting much from this hotel, but I was blown away by the quality and service of everything. There is even an espresso machine! Our stay was pleasant and will definitely book here again when we decide to stay overnight in CA again. Also, there is a security guard at all times at the parking lot, so you know your car is in safe hands.

Went to the Upstairs rooftoop bar. Super cool vibe with the occasional pretentious overdressed patron. Drinks are a little pricey but it's expected. If you get there early evening (5ish) you can get a beautiful sunset view without the overly eager late night crowd. Cool spot.

Went for happy hour $1 oysters. When we were sat, they severer disappeared. We were brought menus, asked about the oyster, and the server had to go get the happy hour menu which I feel he should have given us when we sat down, as it was during happy hour. When the oysters arrived, there was no ice, no fork, and no explanation about the oysters at all. Nice view.

I popped into the Ace Hotel last night to check it out and they recommended going for a drink on the rooftop. I was impressed with the cool vibe, being able to relax by the pool with a full bar and bar food. The sun had just set, which created a beautiful view of LA.

Staff was all fantastic! The room was very nice, but very small. The bed was a bit firm, but pretty comfortable. It was super low to the ground though! We had a very nice stay. We did find it odd that there was no door or curtain for the shower!

Location and ambiance were great. Food was different than your usual fare but delicious. Bloody mary was smokier than I like but was very tasty. The rooftop was a wonderful spot on a sunny day and the cocktails were original and delicious.

I was visiting some friends in downtown LA and we stopped by this hotel to check out the rooftop bar. The views are amazing but be prepared to pay as the drinks are on the expensive side.  The drinks were very good and service was quick. We enjoyed ourselves for an hour or so. I would recommend it if visiting!

I always love staying at the Ace.  This one in downtown LA is particularly nice.  It's attached to an old theater.  The staff were all very nice and accommodating even helping me book a last minute extra night.   The restaurant in the front is nice and if you're a hotel guest you get to save 10%. An added bonus is that my room had a record player with albums to play.

We stayed here for two nights over Labor Day Weekend and had a great experience!  Room was spacious and loved the amenities.  Enjoyed the rooftop bar and the bar downstairs as well.  Front desk and ambience was awesome!  Only negative is price to park.  $40 a night for the valet and $25 to self park in the lot right beside it, but I guess that is DTLA for you.

Went to the rooftop bat area.  Like the space, open and easy to be sociable. Great view of the LA skyline. Bar service was a bit slow, bartenders have an almost nonchalant attitude about them, which is great as long as it doesn't disrupt the flow of service. The rooftop is non smoking which is the main reason i didnt give 5 stars.

This is a very unique hotel. We really enjoyed the architecture. You feel like you are staying in a New York apartment. The customer service is outstanding👍 It is right next to the beautiful Ace Theatre, where we say Kasey Musgraves perform, which was nice because we just walked right over to the venue. The only reason I didn’t give them a 5 star rating was because nobody told us about the live rooftop bar plays until 1 am and we were on the 13th floor, which made sleeping problematic for us. It was loud! My husband called downstairs to complain and they were very apologetic and offered to bring us up some earplugs, and said they were going to stop in about 15 minutes, so my husband said no need for the earplugs if they were going to be done in 15, but they kept playing for over an hour after that. The other minor thing was that there wasn’t any hand soap at the bathroom sink and not and coffee pods to make coffee that is normally in hotels. The coffee pot was there, but that’s it. The only soap was in the shower and that was a big bottle of body soap encased in a shower holder, so we had to go to the shower for soap each time we had to wash our hands. Other than that, it was an enjoyable stay 👍

I went to the roof top bar and the views where great. I got one of the lounge areas right next to the fountain. They had a long line for drinks o wish it was faster. They also seem to have great bottle service and VIP sections.

This review is for the theater here. The theater is absolutely beautiful, but be aware that seat placement near the front rows are absolutely horrible. Expect to have a person seated directly in front of you at your same height. You are better off getting seats in the back or in the balcony.

Went to Ace for a tour of the place for a possible wedding reception. The tour was very nice and lady who showed us the reception area and rooftop bar was was nice, patient, knowledgeable, and proud of Ace. The hotel reception area had a minimalist design with exposed concrete pillars a view across the street and was well lit. It was well laid out with power outlets everywhere, easy access restroom, with one whole side of a wall painted black for chalk. The rooftop bar had great views of the city all the way around with a well stocked bar. Ace is an awesome place to hang out.

One of the nicest hotels I have stayed in. Impeccably clean everywhere! I was amazed that this hotel was not brand new. I was upgraded to the Ace Hotel Downtown Los Angeles and loved it. The fireplace adds a homely feel. The bathroom was a highlight as it was huge, the floors were clean enough to eat off of and the shower was so amazing I didn't want to get out! The service is top notch. Three examples, I was walked to the elevator by James the receptionist who explained where the pool and spa were, to make a right out of the elevator.. what to dial to reach him. I was running out to grab some food at night when the doorman gave me an umbrella letting me know its raining, and third was the event staff. I was there for a work event, and there were meals served and the waitstaff were so observant that when getting the eggs I mentioned hot sauce to a coworker, and one of the staff brought over a little Tabasco bottle to my seat. Oh and their coffee is amazing!
Beautiful, unique and elaborate decor and part of LA history.

For the price they charge (five star) it's really not worth it. The location's cool, it's packed with hipsters and the restaurant is tasty, but it's overpriced. The rooms are cramped - we had a medium and it was very small compared to your average hotel room. They're styled in an interesting, but not amazing ways (yes, I've seen rust, brass and black walls before).  The service, I have to say, was awesome. The greeters, valet, servers, front desk - all super helpful and friendly. This was greatly appreciated.  It's just after staying at the Ace in Portland - where for a reasonable price we had a stylish and massive room - this was a bit of a let-down. The rooftop "pool" is also just an oversized hottub ;)

The ace hotel is a decent place to stay in downtown LA, as long as you're okay with the kind of hipster style of it. The beds are low to the ground but comfortable, and they have decent pillows. The bathroom doors do not lock which CAN be an issue sometimes, but not always. I've stayed there twice in the past 5 years or so and is stay there again if I was looking for another hotel in that area.

We just stayed here for our wedding weekend, and had a great time. It's well designed and fun, and being able to go down and order 50 tacos from the taco stand next door at 3am was perfect after a long day of drinking and celebration. The rooms are a little small (even the suite), and it's expensive, but I guess that's par for the course in DTLA. Service was great, and we love the rooftop bar. Can't complain after a great weekend.

I went here for a work event. The Ace Hotel is conveniently located downtown. Valet was easy, though not too inexpensive. The staff was kind, friendly, and worked quickly. The event space was as expected. I wish I had gotten a chance to see the rooftop bar, because I've heard good things. Maybe next time.

Frequent traveler here.  Rooftop bar and pool are super cool!  Room is clean, decoration on point. Staff is courteous.  BUT at this price point I was expecting a quicker reaction time from staff. In both instances below it took over 4h to provide a solution. They need a better AC management system, theirs sucks, you cannot switch it off, at all. The smart TV is locked on Google, that’s not convenient if you don’t have google TV subscription and want to watch Netflix or Amazon, it’s locked on dish so most of the channels are encrypted. If you go there on weekend, the building across the street throws a block party from 10-5 so forget about a lazy morning with breakfast in bed. They bump up the ghetto blasters and hammer your eardrums with aggressive hiphop.  Lastly, I booked via Expedia because that was the only hotel not charging any resort or tourist fee, or at least they don’t say it in there. So expect a $25/day tourist fee on top.

Loved love and more love!!!  By far the best hotel i ever stayed at, I love the urban loft feel. I stayed in a Medium room I had a corner unit which was directly behind the “Jesus Saves” sign. You have a full fridge and closet of goodies and full bar.  Quality toiletries! And the shower was amazing! Many windows to set the mood in the morning and sunfall.  Ace Hotel needs to come up with a points or membership, I would stay there every month!

We went to a showing of Singin' in the Rain at the theatre. The theater is restored and it's very impressive. The staff for the event were all polite and professional. Our bartender shared an interesting historical fact as she made our drinks. The general area is full of other historic buildings and was great to just walk around. There was a good deal off bars and restaurants nearby. I'll definitely be coming back for the Last Remaining Seats event next season.

Beautiful building in downtown LA. The rooms are well designed and comfortable, but a little on the small side. The restaurant and cafe downstairs are great but there's lots to explore nearby as well. If the weather is good you can grab a drink upstairs in the roof and even enjoy a swim in the pool!

Great rooftop bar with wonderful views of LA. Two spacious open air areas, one of which has a great swimming pool. Drinks are solid, and the staff is friendly and knowledgeable. Great place to start the night, right in the middle of everything.

Standard size room is comfortable but strange. Toilet is in what looks like a coat closet by the door. Shower has no curtain or door, and bed is very low to the ground and against the wall at the foot of the bed, allowing no wiggle room for a tall person. Amenities and atmosphere are cool and historic. Best for younger people or short people.
Iconic, ornate and gorgeous hotel. Amazing 1920-30s America vibe, records and player in room and great staff! Rooftop bar and pool are low key and enjoyable. Great spot in DTLA.

Awesome hotel, old historical building. Can't get mad when things don't work based on age (I.e. went on opening day and elevators didn't work, climed up all 13 floors to the roof, still had a great time). Don't forget to visit the rooftop and the mezzanine bar/restaurant. Stayed at one of the rooms there was an odd wet puddle in our room, the hotel took care of us which was great but left an industrial fan to help dry out the wet puddle. Still unsure what it was. Been up to the roof many many times, it's a must go place in Los Angeles!

We stayed at the Pacific Inn recently while our home was being treated for termites. Being Seal Beach residents, it was refreshing to be treated like neighbors by the staff. The manager, Freeman went out of his way to make sure our accommodations exceed our expectations. The room was clean, well appointed made out time seem more like a "staycation" than a sleepover. They offer a complimentary breakfast and the coffee machine in the lobby is like a virtual barista. I highly recommend this hotel for your stay in Seal Beach.

Stayed in the medium room which had a cool fit out including a Martin acoustic guitar for late night sing along. The rooftop bar was cool great for wasting a day by the pool or drinks in the evening. The cafe down the bottom does good coffee and reasonably priced. Didn't see much of the down town LA area but there were some cool spots around. Would suggest a car to see the rest of town though.

The mezzanine here is unique. A great way to find a quiet seat overlooking the beautiful chaos of the morning/afternoon below. The rooftop is also nice, compact, but well put together. Great staff and easy parking. This newer (2014) location will quickly become an essential element of the DTLA experience for visitors and natives alike.
Went to the rooftop bar; great views and fun communal seating. Got a ginger beer- they primarily do mixed drinks with a limited beer menu. But I had a good time.

We went to the theatre in the hotel for a live taping of Alec Baldwin's "Here's The Thing" podcast. It was a great venue. Not cramped at all, and the stage was easily visible even from pretty far back into the balcony. We'd definitely go to another event there.

Staff was good, rooms seemed clean. That said, for the price, you had better appreciate the design and history of the building or it will be a letdown.  Rooms were small with some questionable design choices - absorbent panels on the walls and cloth headboards are an 'interesting' choice in a hotel.

We had a spectacular time at the Ace Hotel. We got the Ace Suite for some pre game cocktails before our work holiday party. The outside patio is larger than I thought, and the free-standing tub looks luxurious.  The service was excellent and very accommodating. I will be figuring out any reason to book it again!

It was all right but the last night there was a party on the rooftop bar and I'm not kidding when I tell you it sounded like the party was in our room. Didn't sleep a wink. We called downstairs and the front desk basically just shrugged and said there is an event. Not recommended if you like sleep

Stayed briefly for a conference during the week. Super friendly staff, helped with directions, were accommodating with baggage during shuttle days. Good coffee and absolutely beautiful lobby. Rooms were clean and welcoming.

Great hotel in central location in a nice Art Deco building. Rooms are well appointed, clean, and spacious enough. A tip - don't pay the $36 valet parking; you can park in the same lot for $8 yourself :).  Plus, the blankets are so nice on the bed I almost bought some for myself (the only thing that stopped me is that they're dry-clean only).

I attended the red carpet premiere of Flatliners in The Theater at Ace Hotel. It was a gorgeous theater with an opera style. The decor was a gilded/opulent look. There was free popcorn, boxed water, and soda available. I got to see Ellen Page and her girlfriend in person. It was a lovely night.

I've stayed at an Ace Loft for 5 nights for business. My room was on the 13th floor and because of the Roof Top Bar open until 2am each night with super loud music and people screaming at each other, I couldn't fall a sleep at all so ended up getting maybe 4 hours of sleep each night.  What a nightmare!  Each time I wanted to move my rooms, the front desk told me "we have nothing available" and if I complained more they told me to pack my bags at 11am and wait for them to let me know when a room is available?? How can I make plans when I don't even know when I'll be moving to a room. I had valuable things with me and didn't want my valuables to end up wherever it may have been end up!  On top of everything, the hotel only offers housecleaning until 3pm! You need a fresh towel in the evening? (BTW the Loft suit came with 1 set of towels!) Nope forget about it! So remove your "do not disturb" sign before 3pm if you want service!  Not to mention that when I show my frustration, the front desk has been super rude and completely ignoring my issues.  NEVER EVER I'D STAY HERE AGAIN OR RECOMMEND STAYING HERE!!

Beautiful theater, you cant go wrong whom ever you see. The inside takes you back. So much detail and you could spend an hour just in the lobby. We sat on the balcony and had great view with really good sound quality.

Some of my friends come here when they visit LA and they love this place. The cost is very reasonable and the staff is friendy. And you can enjoy not just your room, but they have a nice restaurant and bar as well. Last time we met at the bar and we had a great time, I love their whisky cocktails.
I love the designer feel and industrial look. Rooms were smaller than I thought however and sparse. But overall the bed was comfortable and the rooftop view is amazing. I felt cozy and clean!
I enjoy coming here. I stayed for my birthday. I loved the room. Very old Hollywood. I've been to the bar for a night with friends, great ambience. I've also dined, highly recommend.

Did not stay at the hotel. Only went to the rooftop lounge. The setup and decorations were great, easy access to bathrooms (which had no long lines), the drinks were good, but the music was not my cup of tea. I'm very picky when it comes to music and the DJ played very basic house instrumental music. Could have just been an okay DJ and maybe they play different music on certain nights. I'm also a die-hard rap and hip hop fan, so I'm very biased in that regard. Nonetheless, the music is a big factor in the environment and vibe which is why I can only give it 3 stars. This was also on a Saturday night starting around 9pm.

We went to see Weird Al at the theater attached to the hotel. Very cool venue to go to. If you have the means I would highly recommend it. It is most choice. The Spanish gotic styling is a great site to see. Very unlike the facade on the outside. Very unique.

Horrible.  Stayed in Ace in London multiple times, loved it, so expected the same level of rooms in Ace LA. But was wrong.  Very small room, very small bed, tiny shower with toilet next to it with, no privacy.  Filthy, dust everywhere, dirty broken window glass, blanket with holes, overused shower curtain with holes, mouldy shower floor, stains all over the carpet and furniture.  No sound proof, so expect to hear music from the bar area of the hotel (till 2am).  Filthiness, overused bed sheets and towels are beyond disgusting.  Had to cancel the rest of my stay here and change to a proper hotel.  Would love to get my money back for one night that I had to stay in this place.  It’s a hostel quality stay for $402 a night.  Update:  Only boiling hot water from all faucets.

I thought that the staff would just be a nice addition to the hotel, but they totally made the trip. All of the staff were very friendly and welcoming. Balcony room I stayed in was absolutely gorgeous. The hotel is great about giving hotel guests access and making sure they're accommodated.
Please thank the managers and employees for the great experience we had at your hotel. What a beautiful place, guys! Strongly recommended!

This is my second time here this year. I am going to stay here every chance I get when I'm in LA. Great place for Uber pickup and drop off. Best Girl is a good restaurant and room service was always fantastic. The Upstairs, pool/bar/lounge, was nice too. Front desk was always calm and helpful when I called (the fact I felt comfortable calling them says a lot for I have a phone phobia).

Incredible hotel. Rooms are beautiful with Pendleton blankets. Staff are friendly, genuine and helpful.  Rooftop bar is a great spot.  If I had any criticism it would be that the elevators take an inexplicably long time. What's that about?

Went to a book release event for David Lynch's "Room to Dream." The theater was amazing. I ordered an espresso from the coffee bar before the show. It was decent, but not amazing. I'd definitely see another show here, but I'd get a cappuccino instead.

Went to a monthly 'Movie Trivia' on Sunday starting at 7:30pm. An extremely fun event, but hard as hell. Bring your A-game! Otherwise, hotel was an older style which had a cozy restaurant on the first floor. A nice place to relax and escape the LA heat.

The staff was friendly. There's a nice coffee shop downstairs. If you need a bike, amp, guitar or mic... You can borrow one from the lobby. I had a medium room, it was very spacious. TV was great, lighting desk and bathroom all great too. I'd 100% go back.

The Watsky concert there was amazing! The atmosphere of an old opera house made it a very enjoyable few hours. The only complaint that stands out is that you won't have a lot of elbow space in the seats and the seats DO NOT have cup HOLDERS.

Although I didn't stay here, we came for lunch and for drinks on the rooftop - and loved it! Modern, beautiful interiors, great food, tasty drinks, amazing vibe and tunes on the rooftop - and not as packed as we thought it would be! Perfect place to hang out and experience the best of DTLA.

The rooftop bar was really cool. I really enjoyed the music. The pool is really small, so don't expect it to be spacious or super accommodating. The drinks are delicious and exotic according to my friends who indulged
Night of the Living Drag!!! Fabulous show 👏  Great place 👍

Myself and my wife visited the hotel for the second time, and this time was for a concert we came to see RY X and the concert venue is magical the seating is perfect and the design and architecture will leave your eyes wondering around looking for the details all around. If you visit for a concert venue expect expensive drink prices plus not many options on snacks I would eat before at the roof top bar or after make reservations of course  Enjoy
I enjoyed my stay here. Only issues were the shower curtains are gross and the windows seem old and don't filter out much street noise. Otherwise it was clean and comfortable.

The hotel is mediocre and overpriced. My girlfriend and I booked the hotel with high expectations due to the website, however we were also highly disappointed once we arrived in the room. The hotel is overpriced, the room was small (we had a medium sized room) unlike the photos online, and the hotel books last minute private events on the rooftop which bars use the pool/rooftop. We asked about the events they'd be hosting, we were given a list of events, and told the rest of the week past Tuesday would be open, however, the hotel scheduled another private event for that Wednesday. We were given six free drink vouchers valued up to $15 to compensate, but we both are 20 years old so they were useless. After 7pm the rooftop, which the pool is located, becomes 21 and over (not listed on website as of 6/18/17). Not once did we actually get to swim in the pool. In all, we paid ~$3000 for five nights at this deceivingly labeled five star hotel. Rooms are smaller than pictured. The pool is often off limits. Must be 21 and over past 7pm to swim in the pool. Save yourself the trouble and book at the Ritz.

It was a lovely hotel. Beautiful interior. The bathrooms were pretty with a separate "powder room." Didn't have any problems getting in. Definitely will be back, hopefully I'll be able to see something in their theater next time.

I loved my stay at the Ace!!!  Warm welcome upon arrival at the valet that continued through to the lobby as we checked in.  Spent 2 nights at the hotel and took complete advantage of the rooftop pool with the views of DTLA and beyond.  We ordered food and drink and were quite content spending a lazy day in LA poolside!  Excellent coffee in the lobby restaurant /snack shop.  Loved everything about this hotel except the shower.  Another shower curtain was completely necessary to contain the water never mind privacy if you are sharing a room with a modest traveler.  But I wouldn't let that alter a 5 star rating...well done guys!

One of my favorite LA hotels. Beautiful revamp of a historic LA building, nice room, great roof top bar, in the middle of ton of stuff and hip crowd. DT LA downtown so if your looking for squeaky clean American suburbia this not the area for you. Highly recommend packing a pair of earplugs.  Can’t wait to stay again!
The view from the rooftop bar was amazing. The drinks were enjoyable but the view/ambiance is really what you're there for. The bartender was very responsive and the service was good.

It is by FAR the most unique hotel we have ever been too. We love the raw, clean look in the rooms and enjoy the little touches of character. Such as the record player and the guitar in the room...or the blank music sheets for your own music creativity! We love it!

Loved the location and the atmosphere. If you are a hipster you better hop on over and check out the beautiful furniture and amazing art in the lobby and restaurant. The beds were slightly more comfortable than the pillows you are clearly will never be able to steal! My only complaint is the "dipping pool" that is nothing more than a giant hot tub that isn't always as hot as it outta be. Also thanks for not calling the cops on our huge party!
Classy environment and friendly staff members. I stayed in the medium with terrace. Enjoyed every moment of the stay. I will coming back to taste more of the LA night life and everyday rust and bust.

I would pass on this one. Came for a show and thought it would be easier to stay at the venue. Really not. Super limited parking and extra high VALET only fee.  I was a few hours before check in and was told they would call when my room was ready. Wandered around for a few hours and checked back after 3 and suddenly I had a room and no apology about not calling. I had also been hanging around and seen other people come in and get their rooms before I went back up. Not a good experience.  They give you a card for 10% off their resturant but don't tell you that you need a reservation to actually dine there.  The elevator is so dark I had to use my phones flashlight to see what button I needed and you have to tap your room card for it to work. This was not explained upon check in.  They also authorized twice the room charge on my credit card. I've spent over 4 weeks traveling this year staying at 5 and 3 star hotels and NEVER had any of them authorize twice the room amount.  The light switches in the room are very hard to see and not the normal type. Some have an on and off button. Some don't. Very weird.  If you want a warm shower you need to heat up the ENTIRE room as the shower is open and has no curtain or anything to contain the water or the heat in. Any part of you wet and NOT under the water will be COLD. Also the water never got above warm. I had it turned all the way to hot as far as it could go and warm was all I got. The shower head is high enough that anyone tall won't have to bend weirdly to get under it but also you cannot reach up and adjust where the water flows.  The towels are in a box under the sink. The tiolet is in a London size closet (ie super small). Not enough lights or outlets near the ikea style bed. Can't close the curtain all the way because of the way its hung.  The bare comcrete with other peoples foot prints in it waa not impressive.  The mini fridge is full of extremely expensive beverages and alcohol. Had to move them around just to fit in a bottle of water. Didnt even look at the price for all the nasty sugar snacks they left either.  There is a goos sized glass bottle of water but didnt look sealed or any brand so suspect its refilled with tap water.  Overall I am not impressed and glad I'm only staying 1 night.

Perfect for date night, chill and trendy spot to have a drink then head out to explore DTLA . Valet parking is $8 with Bar validation.  We came on a Saturday night and it was a bit crowded, there’s two sides pool area and the side where the music and bar is happening.

Stunning rooftop bar. Serves a wide selection of drinks (including yamazaki). Wife asked for a drink that was sweet and fruity and they made her an off menu drink that was delicious. It does get rather crowded but I expected this so I can't ding them on that.

Great venue for rooftop drinks. Come on Sunday afternoons and there's usually a set of DJs playing chill, but fun tunes, and you can enjoy the great LA weather along with tasty cocktails. No cover charge so it's an easy way to get together and hang out.

It was a bad experience for me. Stunning rooftop and theatre but the swimmingpool is super small. The rooms are just uncomfortable - they try to be hipster but the staff is too informal and unprofessional. The price is really a fraud compared to the rooms. The location is great.

I was attending the David Lynch Foundation's Festival of Disruption. The service was excellent and the venue was amazing. One of the most beautiful theaters I've ever been to with an amazing screen, lighting and sound. I didn't stay in the actual hotel portion as it was out of my price range, but it seemed nice and I heard good things about it from other people attending.

Nice location. Taco stand next door is amazing and 24 hours.  A/c works good.  Not sure if I like the bed. Shower is a little confusing on how to control water temperature.  Watch your credit card closely they charged me twice!!!

A friend of mine was staying here and I met her for a drink or two on the rooftop bar. Beautiful views of downtown can be seen from the rooftop bar. There was a DJ spinning the night we were there and the rooftop bar had a really cool, relaxed vibe. We were able to find seats right next to a fireplace and were treated to a lovely view of a tree, wrapped in macrame and fairy lights growing right out of the roof! It was a little louder than I would have liked, but we were able to carry on a conversation and enjoy the music. We were treated to table service and our server was very friendly and knowledgeable regarding the menu. She made some recommendations for us and we both enjoyed our drinks as well as our food. I just HAD to try their avocado toast and it didn't disappoint! Artisanal bread toasted to perfection, topped with what I would say is the equivalent of an entire avocado dressed with what tasted like lemon juice and garnished with sliced radishes, chopped green onions and Furikake. My friend enjoyed the nachos. I drank a couple of delicious appletinis, served in small plastic tumblers.  I was able to see her room and it was absolutely HUGE for a downtown LA hotel room. It had a real industrial loft feel and she had both a guitar and a record player in her room, complete with a nice assortment of records.

Hotel room wasn't ready at check in but they kindly gave us free drinks at the restaurant and roof top bar to make up for the delay. Room was nice and clean. Roof top bar is great. Restaurant has great food.
Beautiful views, great bartenders, and an awesome drink menu
The rooftop bar was a nice spot for my friend's birthday brunch. It would have been even better if we could have ordered brunch off the downstairs menu, but for drinks and bar bites it was lovely.
Beautiful rooms, amazing rooftop bar w incredible views of Los Angeles and lovely customer service 😀

The architecture here is outstanding. Staff was very friendly and enjoyed the concert. A great venue that is just the right size for an intimate evening with the artists while still having a decent crowd.

This is a combo review for the theater and Upstairs bar--I did not stay at the hotel. Came here to see The Bird and the Bee in concert and was so impressed! It looks like just another vintage downtown LA building from the outside, but the inside is more ornate that any other building I've seen thus far. It looks like a movie set for the phantom of the opera, or something. My friend and I'd gotten there early so we could grab a bite and a drink from their restaurant, but faced with bit of a wait we decided to try their rooftop pool area bar instead, which turned out to be very cool. The atmosphere was pretty chill and relaxed, even though it was quite full. Luckily we were able to score a couple of seats at the bar. I had one of their beer and shot combos called the "Thumper," (Elijah Craig 12 yr. Bourbon & House Beer) which was quite good, and a Melted cheese and spinach sandwich that was also delish! Those two items ended up being over $30 plus tax and tip, so a bit pricey, but not out of line for that area, I'd say.  When the concert was ready to start my friend and I took a peek all around the theater and took some fun photos. The theater has assigned seating, which I was kind of bummed out about. I usually prefer general admission and standing, especially since this was a band I liked to dance to, and sure enough I felt like the show was a bit less fun because the seats made it harder for people to get up and dance. But we made the most of it and turned out to be a fun night. Would I come back to see a show here? Maybe, if it's something that would be more conducive to sitting. Otherwise, I may come back just to hang out at their Upstairs Bar again.

For some reason, they don't let you go to your seats until 30 minutes before the show starts. Also, the men's bathroom upstairs only has one urinal and one stall, with the urinal being right next to the sink with no divider. Makes things real awkward. Also, the labels for the seats are really hidden (they're on the armrests) so asking for help from the staff on finding your seat is pretty much necessary for most people. As a result, there was a lot of people waiting around for the staff to help them find their seats when the show already started. This whole fiasco could've been avoided if they had let people in earlier and help people find their seats earlier.

Went for Pop Up Magazine. Valet was friendly and pretty cheap, split between 5 people.The main theatre has upper seating floor as well as ground floor seating. I've sat both on top and bottom, and both experiences we're pleasant.

As a member of LA Conservancy, I was fortunate to have visited the United Artist Theatre at Ace Hotel classic movie palace for a screening during the annual event "Last Remaining Seats". It is located on the edge of Fashion District and many attractions in this historical section downtown Los Angeles.  There is a lot of history to the theatre. It is Spanish Gothic, patterned after Segovia Cathedral in Spain. It is one of the original theatres of the area, the flagship for United Artists motion pictures; the place for film premiers. The best decription is from Ace Hoel website "Mary Pickford's love for the ornate detail and stone spires of Spanish castles and cathedrals is manifest at the theater — a true temple of the arts." It is an amazing place to see a classic film or attend any event, you will be blown away by the level of detail and history.  Of note is the "Jesus Saves" neon sign on the building. When the building fell on hard times and was in quite state of disarray, Pastor Gene Scott used the theatre to broadcast Sunday church services, 1989-2005. It was sold in 2011 to a real estate developer, who converted it into the Ace Hotel Downtown Los Angeles, which opened early 2014.  The hotel houses an outdoor cafe, rooftop cocktail lounge and pool (see review for the lounge, posted separately). There is an interesting display of hand drawn figures of Los Angeles Pride throughout, and a good selection of merchandise in the gift shop.  It is centrally located, so if you choose to stay here, you are within walking distance to shopping, restaurants, Los Angeles Staples Center and LA Live, as well as other attractions. It is also short distance to LA Metro, and there are buses and other transportation options.  A unique experience that is a MUST if you visit downtown area, whether you stay in hotel, are lucky enough to see a show in theatre or just want to grab quick bite and people watch.
Beautiful rooftop bar with plenty of space and amazing views. Reasonably priced drinks and great service. There's also a pool if the weather is warm enough.

I attended a recent premier of a film at the Ace, and I must say that the venue itself is one of the nicest looking venues I've been in. We were initially seated at the back of the floor seats, but we moved up to the balcony seats because the floor seats aren't sloped enough to allow for looking above the heads of the people to your front if you're on the shorter end. If you can get the balcony seats, I greatly recommend you do so.

The food in the hotel is priced reasonably and we ate out locally a handful of times. The pool bar provides an excellent all you can eat breakfast with hot/cold buffet, tea, coffee, juices etc included for only few bucks.

Very "trendy" well located for downtown, a bit loud, a little inconsistent.  I stayed here on a business trip for 5 nights. I was very excited when I looked up the history of the hotel. When I nearly missed the entrance. It was just delineated by a neon sign that said Hotel. The checkin process was easy, and no issues. Each room uses RFID and it was easy to get in.  The elevator situation is very frustrating. There are two elevators and they are all very slow. For such a large building. As a result people take the service elevator, and employees take the regular elevator because they can't wait. Also the non-guests take the elevator the roof (which is beautiful but it can be a while before getting in and out of the building). I got scolded for using the service elevator by an employee.  The hallways are very creepy. Dimly lit, but reminded me of the shining. Cool art deco, trendy but a little unnerving.  The rooms are minimal. Concrete everywhere, nothing on the walls except for a cork type board.  For a new hotel. no USB outlets which was weird. Lots of booze food and snacks to buy though.  The upstairs bar and pool were awesome. Bartender Erin and others were great. It is one of the hotels biggest assets.  This is a solid downtown choice.  I wish the elevators were faster, less noise during the evening, USB ports in the room. Maybe even a uniform from the hotel staff (Everyone was dressed grungy.)..

Went to the Ace Hotel to get some drinks and food. The drinks were good and the food was great. Got the nachos. At one point I needed to charge my phone and the bartender told me that they charge them in the lobby, apparently they only charge iPhones, just thought that was weird. Otherwise, a good time.

I visited the Ace Hotel for a viewing of Jean Cocteau's La Belle et la Bête rescored by Phillip Glass. The valet parking couldn't have been more convenient and walking to the theater took no time at all. The event took place on Halloween night and the Ace Hotel couldn't have been a more fitting location. The halls were decked out with decorations and colorfully lit. The architecture looked as if it were built with Halloween in mind and each space kept the guests both in awe and in the holiday spirit. The staff were kind, complimentary, and more than willing to offer aid to those looking for it. Even the security staff was exceptionally kind and smiled at the guests as they passed by. After the film, the after party was handled incredibly professionally. Drinks were served in a timely manner and there was no trouble moving from place to place throughout the building. Basically, it was wonderful night that I won't soon forget and I can go on and on about how well the event was hosted, but I'll just say the Ace Hotel staff know what they're doing. A fabulous evening with fabulous service.

I always love visiting the Ace hotel for concerts. I've now seen city and colour and Tegan and Sara and both experiences were great. Pro tip: there's a secret bar downstairs by restrooms. Pro tip #2: get drinks at "upstairs" (that's the bar's name) next door on the roof. It's an amazing view.
Great gothic architecture. I'm amazed this beautiful theater has survived. All seats are good. Close enough to feel the energy of the star!  It was an awesome experience to be there. Love it.
Love the ambiance. Great restoration. My only knock is the size of the pool. An oversized hot tub if you will. Still a nice place to chill and unwind in DTLA. Would stay again.
The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable and well-stocked. It was a very convenient and welcome option to have the hotel right next to the theater where we saw a show.

Amazing views, great drinks, ok music, difficult to find seats, but ultimately a twinkling blend of Mad Men-esque class with a distinct California-casual breeziness. Come dip your toes in the pool no matter what!

The wonderful welcome and friendly service made this hotel feel like a real home, and it has the perfect location since it is located at the center of the city! I was very satisfied with this hotel!  Highly recommended!

I was disappointed with my first stay at the Ace Hotel DTLA. The rooms (mine was a medium) was cramped, awkward and minimally appointed. The bed was in the middle of the room - leaving nowhere else to sit. The bathroom took minimalist to a new level: barren might be the appropriate term.  Giving this place three stars since the staff were wonderful. Bonus points for leaving a small envelope for a housekeeping staff tip. I wish more hotels would follow.

The theater was old and really awesome. The time it took to create such intricate designs and the characteristic quality is only made more beautiful by the handcrafted designs. Loved it. Would 10/10 take a girl that I was trying to impress here.

We decided to stay here for the event at the Staples Center. We could walk back and forth conveniently, and the restaurant options around the hotel was pretty good, too! Loved the medium room with a King bed - although I could see it getting a little awkward with a shower booth with no privacy, haha.

The only reason this place earns a star is because of the helpful staff at the front desk.  The rooms are ridiculously warm.... the ceiling looks as though it's still being constructed... the bed as low as something you'd see in Japan and as loud and uncomfortable as something you'd see in the dark ages....oh and the bartender! who closes at 1:30am, refused to serve my friend and I a drink at 1:20am. you'd think that he'd want to make as much money as possible. Or given that it's L.A., and based on the way he looked us head to toe as we walked in, he probably assesses patrons based on how much money he thinks they have to spend/tip.

Went for a show in the theater, it was nice though there were limited snacks and no readmittance so no hotel restaurant from what I could tell. Not sure if this was specific to the show or general concessions. The theater itself was beautiful and seemed adequately staffed for the number of people.

The roof top bar is quaint and very spacious. They had a tremendous variety of drinks. I suggest a 57th street for the early morning drinkers. I enjoy day time events and this bar is perfect for that. Park across the street for $5 straight up.

Went to Ace to see Snap Judgement Live. Awesome show! Friendly staff at the bar. However, there isn't good coordination on shuffling people frok the lobby into the theater. As a result, the curtains to enter the theater remained open for a lot of the show. This meant light and sound pollution from outside the theater. Also the seats dont have cup holders. Other than that, chill venue

One of the best roof tops in downtown Los Angeles, this place is a good sister to the New York Ace. There’s a “pool” that is more like a wading area than a pool, right next to the roof top bar and lovely lounge area. The architecture is amazing and the ppl are usually pretty chill. Love it.

Very thoughtful and sleek contemporary design. Staff were super helpful and friendly - also fantastic for a chat. Great downtown location. Rooftop bar, the on site shop and Ace Theatre, also a big cool thumbs up.
Awesome place and Service is Great.. Amazing Staff

I attended the Ace Hotel Theater for their Halloween, Beastly Ball event. The area was beautifully decorated alongside the wonderful 1920s architecture. Next door houses a restaurant and an elevator that takes you up to the rooftop bar and pool. The rooftop view overlooks part of downtown Los Angeles - all of this is part of the Ace hotel. Service at the rooftop bar and theater were met with friendly faces.
Only place I’ll stay. The staff is awesome, the views are awesome. I can’t find a single thing I hated. Thanks Ace Hotel!

Cool venue on top of the Ace Hotel. Great view. Staff couldn't handle the large gathering of professionals there, so it wasn't the best spot for a large corporate party. Bar tenders seemed like they had a chip on their shoulder.

This review is only for the UPSTAIRS - the bar/pool on the rooftop of the hotel. The space is very nice, three different areas; one space has multiple tables to sit and eat with great views. The large bar is located inside - and you walk through it to get to the pool space. The pool side has a small wading pool, there is no way you could swim in it, as it's too small. There are a handful of tables on this side, but also a large oversized couch that fits 10 or so people.  The menu is very diverse, with muddled drinks and speciality liquors. Unfortunately our service was awful. When first sitting outside, the wait staff appeared to see us, but only attended other people around us. We were eventually approached, and when the rest of our party came by, we moved to a table. Upon ordering, we provided them a credit card to hold. After our first round of drinks, we waited for the wait staff to return...and waited...and waited. Finally, we went to see what was going on. It turned out that our wait staff had left for the night without informing us. By this time it was too late for us to order another round, so we went, retrieved our credit card, and left. A shame, because the service ruined what could have been a good night.  I hope this service issue was simply a one-off, and should we go back to UPSTAIRS we'll have a better experience!
Beautiful venue! The band I saw sounded great. Bathrooms were smaller but tidy and all the of the staff was friendly. I got there by train so I can't speak for parking.

A simple, modern and a very pleasant place to stay in Downtown Los Angeles. This Ace Hotel has a roof top bar and a small pool. The employees are as friendly as can be without seeming weird. You’re around 15mins away from Grand Central Market if you choose to walk. BE ADVISED YOU ARE NEAR SKID ROAD.
Good coffee stop in a hip little hotel DTLA. Peak in at the old UA Theater next door. It's amazing and host great acts throughout the year. Nora Jones 9/26/2018
